campaign.story:
THE CONCEPT
The Cluebox is an interactive, manually assembled wooden box with various puzzles, which have to be solved one after the other to open the box. Very much like an Escape Room in a handy format! The solution to each and every puzzle is based not on randomness, but only on logical decisions.
The Cluebox is an intriguing challenge. It's difficult to solve, satisfying to hold, and beautiful to display.
The facts about the game:
Special edition in multi-color available only for Kickstarter campaign
Size: 11*11*12 cm
Age: 14+
Players: 1-2
Play time: 60-90 minutes
Can be reset and solved again by other players
Can also be used as a sophisticated gift wrap (size of the gift space is 45mm*60mm*10mm)
Language independent
THE STORY
Davy Jones' Locker.
London, 1720. Ian Kensington, captain of the British Engineering Forces, is responsible for the first successful recovery of a sunken ship. In the report to His Majesty King George I of England, Kensington mentions Davy Jones' locker for the first time.
Despite it being a real artifact, he describes the locker in the context of a legend about the sea devil Davy Jones, who supposedly locks away the wandering souls of all sailors who lose their lives at the sea. It is told that on each sunken ship, he hides a replicate of the locker, promising to release all souls if someone manages to open the box.
 Since the first find, similar lockers were found in shipwrecks scattered around the world. Some of them are still kept in private collections, others in museums. However, nobody has been able to reveal their secret so far.
We are sure that you are the one, who will finally be able to open the locker and force Davy Jones to admit his defeat.
THE DESIGN AND PRODUCTION
According to Davy Jones he decided to create a special version of the box and release it to the community of Kickstarter. His crafty and intrepid team of developers has spent the last eight months designing and testing this special version of the locker. The team explored a wide variety of interlocks and functionalities, and ultimately settled on a final version which was confirmed by Davy Jones as the most sophisticated version of his locker. 
We will not hide that our team participated in the creation of the box, but even we don't have the details how to open it as the final mechanisms were personally crafted by the Sea Devil. In any case the Cluebox „Davy Jones Locker“ is our most complex project to date— both from a design and manufacturing perspective. The puzzle is made with loving care out of birch wood and wood oil, consists of 72 individual parts assembled with care by hand.
TEAM
Our international team of game and puzzle enthusiasts, mainly based in Germany, established in 2015 company  and developed several innovative board game and puzzles focusing in escape games niche. Today we're very excited to present our first Kickstarter and will appreciate your support to bring our product to life. 
Pirate music theme credit to Ross Bugden
Package design Federico Meloni/Chris Lattner
Meet our team member locked in Davy Jones' cabinet and requested to announce start of the campaign.
MEGABOX (Kickstarter special)
For Kickstarter we will produce a special edition of Megabox in multi-color.  Box size is 21,5*21,5*22,5cm. This box is ideal for escape rooms and events with larger amount of people. 
In your pledge for Megabox 2 boxes are included: 1x Megabox + 1x Standards size
 Complimentary artifact - Davy Jones' Sundial
Dear friends of Cluebox,
we have important news to share with you. We're really excited with number of people who decided to support us and we made a serious effort to match the level of expectations and get more mysterious artifacts from hands of Davy Jones.
And today we succeed!  We achieved to get plans of his sundial, which is an important element in the process of solving Davy Jones' Locker: when solving the Locker, keep an eye on the time shown on the clock and don't ever cross the number 12. Otherwise the Locker will turn into ... actually you better don't know what is it, just trust us ;)
Each one of our bekers will receive a wooden kit of sundial as a big thanks for your support.
The size of sundial is 6x6 cm.

Other iDventure Puzzles
 Cluebox - Schrödinger’s cat 
Schrödinger’s cat is a thought experiment by the Austrian physicist Erwin Schrödinger that illustrates the problem of quantum mechanics in every day objects. In this experiment, a cat and some poison are locked in a closed box.
According to Quantum Mechanics after a while the cat will be both dead and alive. Only by looking at the object, in this case the cat, the status will be determined. 
Unfortunately, Schrödinger completely forgot the cat because of his busy daily routine.
We are sure that the cat is still alive, and you must save it!
Box size: 
Secret space size: 1,5*4,5*8cm
Play time: 45-60 min
 Cluebox - Schrödinger’s cat - MEGABOX 
For Kickstarter we will produce a special edition of Megabox.  Box size is 21,5*21,5*22,5cm. This box is ideal for escape rooms and events with larger amount of people.
In your pledge for Megabox 2 boxes are included: 1x Megabox + 1x Standards size
Cryptex (wooden kit)
Cryptex is a portable vault used to hide secret messages. We have produced it as wooden kit, giving you the opportunity to build it on your own, get insights on it's mechanics and of course hide secret message as a present or as part of the a game. 
Size: 10,5*6 cm
Our Cryptex can be easily reset and the secret word can be set to any word up to 6 letters. 
Secret space size: 2*2*8 cm
REWARDS
TIMELINE
Shipping and Taxes 
Every backer is important to us, regardless of location. The reality is that shipping and sales taxes are expensive. To offset this we worked with our shipping partners to get the best conditions for our bakers on Kickstarter.  
For the EU, UK, US and Canada, your rewards will be sent duty-free from within your region - there will be no additional customs charge. We cannot guarantee customs-friendly shipping in areas outside of the US, Canada, UK and EU. There maybe additional duties and/or fees charged by your country’s governmental agencies and/or shipping partners. Those fees are solely your responsibility, and we can neither cancel a shipped pledge, nor will we pay those fees. In the event that a package is returned or destroyed due to the non-payment of such fees, your pledge will be considered fulfilled.
Shipping charges will be added after the Kickstarter ends - every backer will be responsible for paying these in the pledge manager after the campaign ends.

campaign.story:
Witch Hunt is a boutique focused on creating unique and beautiful jewelry inspired by our favorite tabletop role-playing games like Dungeons and Dragons. We want to make accessories for modern, aesthetically conscious players.
We've kept our backing levels short and sweet just like our first campaign. You can back for either one or two sets of our beautiful dice drop earrings. If you can't decide which finish you like best why not get both? 
Each dice drop earring set comes in either Steel or Rose Gold. As you can see in the below image you'll get yours in a durable pull-out box with the Witch Hunt emblem so it is perfect as a gift for a certain special someone. 
 (We know this box doesn't quite fit the earrings comfortably - a manufacturer for new boxes specifically for the dice drop earrings is already lined up!)
Update: Dice Drop Necklace and Bracelet
Due to the great success of the campaign so far and the interest of our backers we've been working with our manufacturer to design a matching necklace and bracelet to the dice drop earring design. See below mockup of the final pieces. We're SO happy how these have turned out so far!
Update: We've added all of our previous jewelry collections!
Just add the value of the jewelry pieces you would like and up your pledge to that amount! We'll be using Backerkit to finalize survey responses and you will have an opportunity to add additional pieces after the campaign ends if you choose. 

What material(s) are the earrings made from?
The main material is surgical grade(8% nickel content) stainless steel, and the rose gold versions have been flash plated with 18k rose gold. 
What length are the earrings?
75mm
Why stainless steel?
Stainless steel by far outperforms gold or silver in terms of durability. We wanted to bring you jewelry that is not only easy to look after and low cost, but that will also last you for many nights of dice rolling.
Can I get more than one?
Certainly! Just multiply your pledge amount by however many more necklaces you want. We'll send out a survey to find out which finish you want after the campaign has completed. 
Witch Hunt HQ is based in the United Kingdom. At this time we cannot guarantee that the earrings will arrive in time for Christmas - but we are pushing hard to get to market asap. Shipping costs have been estimated as follows:
United Kingdom: £2 (tracked)
International: £10 (tracked)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I would love to be able to tell you that these beautiful earrings will 100%, absolutely, definitely be in your hands for December 25th but due to the current world situation and unforeseen difficulties I can't do that. I don't want to be responsible for giving anyone the gift of disappointment this Christmas!

However, as always, Witch Hunt will do its best to be transparent and communicative of milestones and timelines throughout the process.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Hey! We're Max and Mo, cross-continental buddies who make items for games like D&D under the guise of Loot Tavern and Humperdink's Wares. Mo designed some pins, Max wrote some cool effects, and we thought "Hey, why don't we make these in real life as well as in-game."
Need a gift for your favorite player, DM, mother, dog, or teddy bear? Want a unique pin for when conventions return?  Are you just a collector of dope accessories? If so, see what it's all about down below!
Here's how this page is organised:
 Designs - see all the cool pins we've designed!
 Quality - learn about how we're making the pins
 Not Just a Pin - check out some in-game mechanics the pins come with
 Pricing - see the price structure, and shipping time & cost estimations
 Stretch Goals - self explanatory!
 Communication - includes a link to our discord server.


We've made a design for every core dungeons and dragons 5e class, from Artificer to Wizard, including an extra for your favourite DM. We've even been noodling around with some other fan-favorites, but more on that later. Check out these designs! 


This was unlocked when we hit $6000 - on day 1!
This was unlocked when we hit $6000 - on day 1!
Unlocked at $8000 - on day 4!
Unlocked at $8000 - on day 4!
We want to make the best pins we can, and we think we're there. We don't use this word lightly, but these pins are premium.  We've swapped soft enamel for the much more durable and cleaning-looking hard enamel. This has allowed us to add silk-screen printing to the manufacturing process so that we can get those shading effects. 

Each pin is around 1 1/4" or  32 mm wide and is double posted (two mounts) so it doesn't skew when you wear it. The metal is dark gray nickel with rubber backers.

At Loot Tavern, we make item cards. Each pin you get will come mounted on one of those cards. These have original, playtested, 5th-edition item mechanics that you can also give to your players in-game. Talk about breaking the 4th wall!
Each pin gives a minor, class-specific boon bringing a small 'quality of life' improvement to the player's experience. These boons are effective at any level and are flavored to help create cool role-playing moments in your adventures. Check a sample of the cards and the mechanics below!



We're keeping this simple. The more pins you buy, the cheaper they are. Pins cost:
 $9 each if you buy 1-4,
 $8 each if you buy 5-13, 
 $7 each if you buy 14 or more. 
Retailers contact us directly for more info at humperdinkswares@gmail.com.
Check out the table below to get an idea of the total price, as well as which tier you should select.
Additional pins $9 each
Additional pins $8 each
Additional pins $7 each
Total price for pin orders. NB: It's cheaper to get 14 than 13!
One-of-a-Kind Pieces. For anyone who wants their own, bespoke design, we have a tier just for you.  We'll work with you to create your design and mechanical effects. This tier includes the 14 base pins, plus any we unlock through stretch goals, and up to 10 copies of your bespoke pin. Additional copies can be made upon request.
Due to the time constraints, we can only take a limited number of these orders. We'll be closing the tier 1 week before the Kickstarter finishes, to make sure we can get the design ratified by the manufacturer ASAP.

Shipping. We're doing everything possible to get these pins out before Christmas. If we experience no hiccups, we have an estimated arrival date of December 8th, which would allow us to ship the orders that same week. However, in the current crazy climate, the best we can guarantee is a January delivery. Whatever the case, we'll be in touch with you every step of the way.
Prices do not include shipping. For US domestic, we estimate between $6 for a single pin to $10 for a full batch of 14 and should take 3-5 days.
For the rest of the world, we'll be using USPS's First-Class Package International Service. This can take anywhere from 2-8 weeks to arrive, depending on destination. Here are the postage estimates:
 Australia: $19
 Europe: $16
 Japan: $19
 Russia $19
 United Kingdom $16
Please be aware that International backers are responsible for any customs fees their country may ask for, so plan accordingly!


We'll release four more designs when we hit each of $6k and $8k so the full 14 are available as soon as possible. If we hit $10k, we'll upgrade to thicker card stock with a linen finish.
Beyond that, we'll do a new, fan-chosen design at each of the following milestones: $15k, $20k, and $25k. Leave a comment here on the kickstarter with your suggestions for the stretch goal pin designs, and keep an eye on your inbox for when we vote on them! Current suggestions in the mix are bloodhunter, gunslinger, pugilist, and psionic.
  $6k on day 1 and $8k on day 4! Thank you! 



We plan to give you regular updates about manufacturing, shipping, and fulfillment. If you need to get in touch, drop a message on here, send an email to humperdinkswares@gmail.com, or head on over to the discord .
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
No matter how much planning you do, there will always be unexpected hiccups. Just look at the entirety of 2020 so far! Despite that, we've really done our homework. We've chosen a super communicative manufacturer which will allow us to keep you abreast of any issues that may occur.

As well as using Kickstarter's messaging service, you can also hit us up on the Loot Tavern discord using this link: https://discord.gg/Snd6SFy , Head on over to the #pin-kickstarter channel and we'll answer your questions ASAP!

Offsetting Risk:

Cost - We've factored everything in; manufacture, shipping, advertising, and import tax. Due to the number of designs, we have quite a high goal to accommodate the minimum order size for each pin. If we hit the goal, we're good to go.

Manufacture - All the factories we queried had great track records and were recommended to us by other pin designers. The one we chose was one of the more communicative as well as being capable of a high quality finish. Final colours might be slightly different to what you see on the screen, due to the enamel technology!

Shipping - We expect some bumps, and that's why we're not promising delivery by Christmas. However, if the manufacturer gets everything shipped on time, and it doesn't get lost at sea or held up in customs, we should be able to get it in the post on December the 8th. Depending on your location, that might arrive in time for the big day.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
*Please be notice this campaign only delivers digital STL files, there is NO physical product delivery! *

Hello and welcome! 
After nearly two months of hard work I am proud to present to you the Nomadic Caravan Project, which is a collection of wagons, tents, fire camp and various props for different characters that travel around a challenging world facing hardships. Each character has their own unique backstory.

The story behind this project
 Merchant : This merchant offers a broad range of wares, from llama spit to dragon scales! Find what you need, as long as you have the money!

 Merchant`s wife : selling medicinal herbs and spices. If something ails you she might be able to sooth your pain!

 Fortune teller : A woman with a good heart and the founder of the caravan, this fortune teller can reveal what lies ahead of time. She possesses magical abilities, among which is transforming herself into a younger and more seductive self! Who knows, it might come in handy one day! If you enter her tent please do not touch anything! Especially not the chest! Everyone has their secrets, right?

 Sisters of the war pact : Every camp needs guards, and these three sisters are it for our caravan! They have a strong bond with the caravan's founder, our fortune teller, who brought these orphaned girls up as her own daughters. With the proper fee, they'll happily join you in your adventures!

 Torn face : Fighting a ferocious monster with sharp claws left his face torn and disfigured! Lacking the proper expertise, the fortune teller resorted to just stitching the two sides of his face together. Blindness has sharpened one of the remaining senses, the sense of hearing, into an almost superhuman ability! His physical strength remains! No one can survive under his iron fists! 

 Hunter : A sharp shooter with high visual acuity! No hunt is undergone without securing a bounty, bringing game and valuable live specimens back for trading.

 Dishonored knight : Only a true warrior knows the depths of shame after a defeat in combat. Being overwhelmed by his loss in combat, he wanted to take his own life, but some events, and the arrival of the caravan, prevented this outcome. He lost one of his arms, which made room for a curious innovation!

 Troupe group : Sit a while and listen! You will find entertainment for hours while you repose after a long day's journey.

 Servant girl : She was found unconscious, with the recent events being a blank. The only thing she can recollect is a dragon... yes, there was a dragon somewhere! (Stay tuned for future project!)

 Hunter - zombie version : Damn, that crate definitely had a "do not touch" sign on it! Our brave and curious hunter dared to get near a zombie that he found in the jungle, where it was dormant. The creature quickly sensed his presence and fiercely attacked him, succeeding in infecting him with a bite. He got bit but eventually managed to put the creature back in his crate! Our hunter has a secret now, that will end up transforming him! (Stay tuned for future project!)

 Dwarf : Who ever heard of a dwarf that doesn't like his liquor!? This renowned merchant sells the best wines around, sometimes rarities found in deep and forgotten cellars! 

 Merchant`s daughter : Are you looking for fresh wild berries, fruits and vegetables? This is the place to look! This young merchant has a vibrant connection to nature and is easily able to source food!

The scale
All miniatures and props are scaled at 32 mm. All miniatures come in two version: with one inch round base and without a base. You can easily scale it in any size you want.

Delivery time
All of these pictures are 3d renders or just rough sketches so please be mindful that changes can occur. The core set will be available right after the campaign ends but the stretch goals will need some time to get completed (possibly 2 months).

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our eighth Kickstarter and with Seven successful Kickstarters under our belt, so we are well versed with Kickstarter ways and envisage no problems. Other than this we have collaborated with dozens of Kickstarters during these last two years. Providing models all round to community members in some of the most popular campaign offered in Digital on Kickstarter.

All Core models have already been created and will be delivered directly after the Kickstarter end, when payment is received. So no waiting more than necessary for your core files. All Stretch Goals have also been completed, but need to be tested and will be available shortly after that.

DIGITAL MEDIA:
We strive to produce models that will print with as little support and parts as possible. Some models print in one go whilst most are split up into parts which must be printed separately and then assembled.

The file format of choice will be .STL and the models shall be zipped and made available to the user for download. The user is responsible for downloading their product and must have a valid internet connection and email with which to collect their reward, via internet download. We will keep the files on our system for at least three months after the first date of issue. The user must ensure that he collects the files within this time frame or risk forfeit. Lovecraft will always try their utmost to ensure that you receive your files and we hope that you enjoy printing them as much as we have enjoyed creating them. If there are any issues please contact support@i-lovecraft.com

Backers must realize that the resolution you obtain on your print is down to the system you use. Our high resolution files will give you almost render quality prints on high end Resin machines, whilst the same files will produce lesser resolution prints on standard FDM printers. At any rate, the files have been previously tested on Resin and FDM printers and have shown satisfactory produce.

We recommend FDM Prints with at least a 400micron nozzle and 150 micron layer height for terrain. A 100 micron layer height will give you outstanding prints all round.

Resin printers should have no problems obtaining excellent resolution and finish, even at 100 micron layer height although 50 micron layer height is recommended for minute sculpt detail clarity. Although miniatures and figurines can be split into smaller parts, large terrain pieces will require a standard 220x220mm print bed, standard for FDM Printers like the 'Ender3'. We do try to restrict the maximum size of models to 180mm sq where possible.

We supply the user with a design that has been tested on conventional home hobby printers and is proven to print.

All the models are tested and sliced with 'Cura' software which is freeware and available to all backers for use. We recommend that backers use 'Cura' as it is fully tested with our models and we can offer customer support, if any problems are encountered. We are unable to give customer support for other slicing software and backers use this at their own risk.

All the files have been checked using Netfab, this means that PrusaSlicer should have no problems slicing these files. Many of the files are also tested using PrusaSlicer.

All accumulated Grab Bag, Bonus models, also known as Daily Bonus or Free Models are given freely, under no obligation, as is and as a gift and don't form part of the campaign or responsibilities associated with this.

When using our digital media, we do not hold ourselves responsible for the production or manufacturing process of the design, this is exclusively up to the user.

Users may modify models and files at their own risk and only for their own personal use. Modified files are not guaranteed by us and as such, users do this under their own risk and know how.

The Images shown on the campaign page are just for visualization and although they may come very close, they may not be an exact representation of the final design or printed model, which may vary.

We reserve the right to alter any of the models shown, at any time, before delivery, with the intent of improving the design, or efficiency of production.

campaign.story:
Witches, wizards, and warlocks are cool and all, but their companions are even better. Animal familiars can help us scout for supplies or enemies, deliver important information across the land, and even help us in battle! For this Kickstarter, we are aiming to create enamel pins and apparel inspired by some of our favorite animals. You'll see them with items you'd find around the coven that are also reminiscent of the spooky season that is soon upon us. 
Kickstarter helps my designs become a reality! Your credit card will not be charged until the Kickstarter ends, so go ahead and pledge for the tier that you want. We have over 20 days to unlock everything, and with your help I'm sure we can do it. If you would like a customized reward that you don't see, please message me so I can create that reward tier for you! 
 Part one and part two pins are all unlocked!
Part 4 will unlock once we've raised $2387.
 You read it right! We are offering this free pin (color of your choice) for all backers that pledge $24+!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've designed almost 100 enamel pins, so I can confidently say that I know the ropes! I will be working with my trusty manufacturer whom I have worked with for over a few years now. Shipments will be handled by USPS and will be offered to both domestic and international backers! USPS has been through a lot of challenges this year, one of them being the increase of shipments due to the pandemic. I will update all backers with their tracking number, but do note that shipments have been moving a little slower than usual. If you would like to upgrade your shipping to Priority Mail or a UPS service please reach out to me. 

All Apparel will be printed locally in Birmingham, AL with a print shop that I've been working with for over a year now. They are so great because I can go pick them up in person, and even see them be printed if I need to!

In hopes that the amount of seconds is small, packaging and shipments will start immediately upon arrival! As always there can be slight color differences with what appears on your screen, so please keep this in mind!

Don't forget that pins are made of metal, if you have an allergy please be cautious! They also have pointy parts, so keep away from children!

campaign.story:
You're new to town, with only the tools in your backpack, a can-do attitude and the ability to build a new life for yourself on the beautiful island nearby. Unravel the dark secrets the island holds as you venture deeper into the caves in search of mystery and treasure.  Len's Island is a blend of peaceful building, farming and crafting, mixed with intense combat, dungeon battles and deep questing and exploration.
Reaching our funding goal will mean we will be able to create Len's Island to the level we are happy with releasing. If we reach further funding milestones, we will be able to use this money to add many additional features, continue expanding the game post-release and overall make the game better and more polished.
Starting as a solo weekend project just under three years ago, Julian Ball / Flow Graphics created Len's Island as a way to make his own vision for the perfect game come to life. Now developed by a small indie team, development has progressed over the years to form a beautiful, immersive, captivating and meaningful experience which we call Len's Island.
Len's Island brings excitement and progression for many playstyles, all within a vibrant and engaging world. Catering to the hardcore dungeon-crawler fans, home-builders and decorators, explorers and completionists, farming fanatics, collectable hoarders, and people who just want to live the simple life chopping trees as the sun goes down.
Len's Island is planned to release late March 2021, on Steam for PC and Mac. With potential plans for other platforms, but you'll just have to wait and see...
Why are we on Kickstarter? The short answer is, making games is expensive!! We have been working tirelessly to make this game a reality, some of us for years, some months, all without pay, just with a passion for making a great game. But.. we need some funds to finish this project and let it become the amazing experience we wish it to be.
Len's Island has been in development for just under three years. The first year was Julian, working alone to get the game into a prototype state and see how it played. Making the prototype was a quest to find a perfect blend of creative building, intense dungeon-crawler action, and calming exploration, all inside of a lush and vibrant world that makes you feel right at home. Now with a small team, we have rewritten the original code and rebuilt the game from the ground up.
At this stage of development, we have the core systems built, the starting levels and core design almost finished along with a small library of content. We are in the middle of production, starting the alpha-testing phase and iterating on the content we have so far. The next stage of development is polishing the systems we have in place, filling the game with more content like quests, items, more dungeons, and just generally more fun stuff to explore and do.
This is a sneak peek for one of the background tracks. Give it a play, read through the Kickstarter page and imagine you're exploring your own island.
Build the home of your dreams. Build wherever you want, make it as big as you want, paint the walls, add some decorations, make it your own.
We have developed a building system that functions using an easy drag-n-drop interface, with deep customization and limitless creative freedom to build. Start with the structure using the ever-growing library of building pieces. Then choose what style you want to build in, whether it's basic wooden beams, cobblestone, ornate brickwork or a blend of them all. You can paint and customize styles so you can make it truly YOUR home. Want blue walls, white window-frames and a red door? DONE. Then for the finishing touches. Add some decorations, place your bed, build a wardrobe, a weapon rack, a tool chest, and much much more.
After a treacherous journey into the dungeons or a long day completing a quest, you need a haven to come back to that makes you feel right at home. Our goal for the building in Len's Island was to create a system that allows you to create a home that you can truly be proud of.
Len's Island is also a fast-paced, skill-driven dungeon crawler with a strong focus on engaging a wide range of combat types and loadout combinations. There are many ways to progress in Len's Island.  If you're getting bored of building your home, tending to your crops and meeting the local townsfolk, there are deep, dark caves below the Island with plenty to explore.
As you clear the dungeons you will defeat dark creatures, unlock mysteries, complete challenging puzzles, and better your skills in combat. There's also lots of rare ores to mine, hidden areas to find and broken paths to repair. When you travel deeper into the caves you will start to unravel the mystery of what makes the Island so unique.
Combat is agile and skill-based with a high skill-ceiling for experienced players wishing for a more nuanced experience. Customize your loadout with over a dozen weapon classes and a wide selection of niche weapons. From wielding magical staffs and iron daggers to fiery war axes and rapid-fire bows. Take your own journey through Len's Island and fight the way you want to fight.
These are all work in progress animations and attacks. Player animations and more weapon variants are a couple of the key areas that benefit greatly from Kickstarter. We're not animators so we're doing our best with what we have so far.
There's more than one way to make some coin in Len's Island. You can loot the dungeons, complete quests, or gather resources and sell produce grown from your farms. Discover rare fruits, attract new wildlife to your home, make your crops look beautiful and make some good money while doing it. 
Use farms to grow the food which fuels your ventures into the dungeons and long days exploring the Islands; as well as grow exotic plants and flowers to sell back to the villagers for gold.
Grow large-scale farms throughout the forest, or care for small garden beds on your balcony. Or if you're not the green-thumb type, place some pot plants and call it a day. 
We will have a lot more farming features to show further as we progress deeper into development. Farming is essential if you want to keep your health topped up and your belly happy. You can also use farming as a great way to earn gold to craft better weapons, upgrade your backpack and buy exotic items.
Questing plays an important role within Len's island. Help villagers with simple tasks like gathering some wood for Martinel or take on more dangerous ventures like finding lost loved ones trapped in the dungeons. You can make a big impact within the town and make some nice coin while doing it!
You're not the only person who's called this Island home. Rescue villagers, fix up the run-down cabins on the island and help them get back on their feet.
You can repair and upgrade more than just your own home. Fix broken bridges leading to hidden treasures, upgrade parts of the local town, and uncover secret areas.
When backing Len's Island you will receive a small demo a few weeks after the successful completion of the Kickstarter. Demo copies will be sent on the 24th of September. This demo will be a little mini-Island that we've created. A place where you can build a house and get a feel for the game. 
We may look like all fun and games, pun intended, though we have been working tirelessly for years to make this project happen. We all share a common passion, and that is to create games and experiences we care about and are truly proud of.
Our collective professional background and complementary skills are what makes us a great team. Julian's experience ranges from freelance graphic design and game art, to working within large companies as a marketing director and chief operations officer.  Lars has worked as a professional music composer, sound designer and graphic designer for many years, releasing various self-titled tracks and composing for games such as Team Fortress 2. Martin has lectured in game design and game programming, as well as worked on various indie-game titles over the years.
Kickstarter will help immensely with filling the game with more great content, paying expensive bills that any start-up indie studio has to pay, along with expanding upon our current scope. We can hire an artist to make more weapons, character animations and a variety of visual assets. As well as paying our music composer and SFX designer Lars to continue to create beautiful tracks and much needed audio effects for the game. The vast majority of the money raised will simply go directly back into the game itself to make it that much better, adding more content and a higher level of polish. We will need some of the cash to pay business costs, things like accounting, trademarks, set up fees, software licensing, legal fees, etc. Then if there's any money left over, we can use it for marketing and help pay the bills to make sure none of us ends up homeless while working on Len's Island.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Creating any game has its risks. We try to mitigate and minimize any risks as much as possible with careful planning, project management and always leaving room for contingency. Len's Island is completely self-funded, with Kickstarter being the only external source of income. We chose to fund the game through Kickstarter in order to further minimise risk and ultimately make a better game. Having to keep big publishers happy, or even being forced to change key elements of the game is super risky in our minds. We just want to make the game that we know is great, into a completed and polished title ready for launch.

All of the funds from Kickstarter have 1 key goal in mind, to make Len's Island the best it can possibly be. We will use those funds to eliminate and minimise any risks associated with the game's finance, project timeline, level of polish, legal matters or business structure.

Massive Darkness 2: Hellscape takes the exciting dungeon-crawling action of the original Massive Darkness and brings it to a whole new level!
Take on the role of Lightbringers, a group of Heroes fighting the forces of Darkness in this thrilling cooperative game for 1-6 players.
Inspired by classic RPG games, this stand-alone board game needs no game master to take you to the depths of Hell and beyond, fighting a variety of mobs and epic enemies to save the world! 
 Learn more about the Optional Buys: Demon Dragon, Gates of Hell, Four Horsemen, War of Souls, Druids vs Beelzebub, Massive Darkness Original Tiles Set, Zombicide Fantasy Crossover Pack, 3D Pack: Hellscape, MD2 3D Pack: Doors & Bridges, MD2 3D Pack: Chests & Pillars, Hellscape Frost Dice, Heaven & Hell Frost Dice, Gamegenic: All-In Sleeve Pack, Gamegenic: Core Set Sleeve Pack, Gamegenic: Quest Organizer, and Gamegenic: Token Chest. 
Check out how strong the Gamegenic sleeves are in this Stress video!

We will collect this via our pledge manager after the campaign ends, using PayPal. This is so we can be fair to all our backers as shipping is rarely one size fits all, and also give you more stretch goodies and possibly a choice of carrier options.
We will ship your rewards at our cost to our international hubs. Depending on where in the world you are, we will either ship to you from our hub in the EU (EU/UK backers), China (Asia backers), Singapore (Singaporean backers), Canada (Canadian backers), Australia (Australia and New Zealand backers) or Atlanta (USA and the rest of the world). Following is a list of rough estimates for shipping a basic Hellscape pledge. Keep in mind these are just estimates and that accurate costs will be calculated in the pledge manager system according to your address. Also keep in mind that costs will likely rise based on optional buys you choose.  
*Latin America, Africa, and ROW estimates are based on USPS rates. If USPS is not available, these rates may change.
Unfortunately, different import laws and customs have made it impossible for CMON to ship games to certain specific countries.
WE DO NOT SHIP TO: Russia, Ukraine, Kazakhstan and Afghanistan.
Be aware that any pledges that are confirmed after the pledge manager deadline is considered a "Late Confirm" and will be shipped from the USA hub at a later date. For non-US backers, that will likely incur increased shipping costs. Also, note that Late Confirms will not be able to customize the contents of their pledge. They will be offered a single pledge, including most, if not all, Kickstarter Exclusive Optional Buys. We also cannot ship to PO Boxes domestically or internationally. Due to the size of each package there is too great a risk of the package being bounced back to us.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 45th Kickstarter, and there are some vagaries in terms of timing when it comes to anything produced in China, such as:
Production delays
Shipping delays
Customs delays 

The estimated delivery date for this project is September 2021, but keep in mind this is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

We've done our best to minimize this as much as possible, and we are always happy to refund pledges if for some totally unforeseen reason the game can't be delivered at all.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment, no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds after the 14 days close of the campaign may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.

This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the 8 week window has elapsed. Unconfirmed pledges make it difficult for us to plan production and logistics, and in the past have led to project delays. For this project we do not intend to allow this to happen, which may mean if you confirm your pledge too late, exclusive items may not be produced in sufficient quantity for your pledge.

If you confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret we are unable to ship to PO Boxes.

All backers that have selected “No Reward” on Kickstarter, that wish to receive a reward for this campaign, must make sure to confirm their order by the Pledge Manager Deadline. We will announce the date for this once the Pledge Manager becomes live. All “No Reward” pledges will be treated as donations once the Pledge Manager Deadline has passed.

If you do not accept these terms please do not pledge on this project, but instead wait for the retail release.

To make sure you have the best gaming experience, all CMON products are warrantied against manufacturing defects for 2 years from the of date purchase from CMON (proof of purchase required). If you open your game and see that something is missing or broken, our customer service team will work hard to get you replacement parts and make things right. Simply contact them at https://support.cmon.com/hc/en-us.
Note: Warranty does not cover accidental damage, theft, loss, or any other event that is not a manufacturing defect.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
"A new strain of a dangerous virus threatens to overwhelm the human body unless all players wisely cooperate. Take charge and direct the immune response in this inner quest: Become the hero you need!"  
Cup of Hygeia (Goddess of health)
 I am a biologist and I have worked on viral evolution for more than 15 years. Around 2010, I started pondering the idea of a cooperative game where you fight a viral infection. At first, I simply wanted to share with people the immense awe I feel when I learn about the beautiful, constant struggle of the immune system. However, several events resolved me to finish it and to strive to give it a wide exposure.    
Magnification level 1: Human body
First, a beloved friend died of AIDS, when he was only 33 years old. His death was a heartrending blow for me and our tight-knit group of friends, especially because nowadays infection with the Human Immunodeficiency Virus can be treated so easily. He loved board games and I promised myself to finish the game one day and dedicate it to his memory.       
Magnification level 2: Heart cross section
Second, I grew increasingly worried by the rise of misinformation regarding the boon for humanity that vaccination has been. These feelings gave way to a conviction: that a way to inoculate the minds of people against this pernicious idea is to provide an accessible experience that would teach them the basic workings of the immune system.          
Magnification level 3: Heart tissue
Most people live their lives unaware of the epic fight between life and death that takes place inside the complex microcosm of their bodies every day. However, I didn't want a dry simulation or lifeless educational tool: I play board games every week and I wanted to create an easy to learn, dynamic and fun experience.       
Magnification level 4: B-cell, the hero with a thousand trillion faces
Third, the COVID-19 pandemic brought a sense of urgency to this endeavor. I recoiled at the myriad of misconceptions and I think it is this lack of knowledge that brings panic into many hearts. I know that a board game sounds banal in these trying times, but  the huge awareness caused by the disease has generated unparalleled interest in learning about how the immune system fights a virus.       
Magnification level 5: Virus
Finally, I really wish you enjoy playing this game. It would make me very happy to know that at least one person will become a scientist because of this gaming experience: we need more scientists in the world. Along the same lines, for every 20 copies rewarded during this campaign, we will donate 1 copy to a public school or library. I sincerely hope you support us!     
 You can now take "immune" for a spin yourself! 
Tabletopia link
Game rules: For a detailed description, please see the game rules, which come in both English and Spanish versions. For more information, resources and discussions, please see our BoardGameGeek page. 
Brief overview:
Components and first turn:
Detailed description of gameplay:
Turn description: Briefly, each player’s turn consists of three steps: viral replication, energy allocation and immune actions.
Viral replication: The player takes 2 viral tokens from the infection bag and places them on the corresponding organ of the same color. When both tokens go to the same organ, a debilitating disease symptom occurs. 
Energy allocation: The player can move one energy token to an adjacent action tile: The more energy tokens, the stronger the action is.
Immune actions: The player can perform two immune actions, out of the 9 available ones. The immune actions allow players to collect necessary resources, maturate their skills and attack the virus on each organ.   
Immune actions
End of the game: The game continues until either the virus conquers the human body or the immune system learns to recognize the viral strain: the body is now immune.   
Magnification level 6: An example of some of the amino acids needed to learn to recognize the virus

 I hoped to create a game that:
 Was easy to explain. Although I wanted the game to be faithful to the science behind the immune system and thus encourage the player's curiosity, I primarily  wanted a fun and accessible experience. Most of the time we prefer playing games with streamlined rules that are easy to pick up but still provide a meaningful challenge. However, if you wish to play with people without any experience on strategic boardgames, please follow the simplified variant included in the rulebook.
 Was replayable. I like cooperative games because they play differently depending on the group of people. Besides that social aspect, each "Immune" session is different with three difficulty levels and a combination of 1 out 16 viral threats (each with its own stats), a subset of the disease symptoms that can come during game play and a random spatial array of the immune actions. 
 Was mostly language independent. All action tiles and many cards have iconography to show what they do. Although several cards are written in English, each card's description can be found in the rulebook (which contains both English and Spanish versions). I hope to translate the cards to more languages with the help of the board gaming community. However, if you wish to play a completely language-independent game please follow the simplified variant included in the rulebook.
 Could be played solo. In case of victory, the game provides a score to measure and encourage the player's improvement over time. When you have defeated the highest difficulty, you can increase the viral defense value, which will result in even higher scores.
 Didn't have prescribed roles. Roles are interesting in some cooperative games, but I often find them restrictive: there is a single thing you must do, because it is the best thing you can do. Although each player has a once-per game special ability, there are no different roles in “Immune”: each player in this game specializes as the game progresses. 
 Worked at all difficulty levels. After play testing enough the core engine of the game, I searched for the best parameter combos (for example how many disease cards, resource values, etc). Thus, I created a python program (MARVIN) that played the game randomly until victory or defeat. Then the combo's fitness was calculated as how far the average winning rate was from a desired target on each difficulty level. I searched exhaustively over all parameter combos and those that made it into the game were the fittest ones.    
Please see the interview below, where these and other topics are discussed: 
The game will be delivered only to USA, Mexico, Canada, countries in the European union, UK and Australia. The game will be shipped from within the country or region, thus avoiding import fees and taxes. The shipping cost is: "Inner quest" - $7, "Plenty" - $10 (must ship to the same address). 
All pledges must be made in full during the campaign, so we wont allow late pledges or pledge upgrades. 
We estimate that backers will get their rewards on March 2021.
For every 20 copies rewarded during this campaign, we will donate 1 copy to a public school or library.     
 Immense thanks to Alice Steel for her artistic contributions: "Hygeia's cup", body, organs, tissues, B-cell and the virus. Alice Steel is a qualified biologist and practicing artist with a lifelong belief that science and art work best together. As an illustrator her work is continually inspired by nature’s creativity and aims to explore the important connections we have to our ecosystem. 
Thanks to Catalina Mateus, Carolina Parra, Carolina Gomez and the great team at "Globe Creative" for their patient work on the graphic design of the game. 
I would like to thank all our Playtesters: Inna Rytsareva, Michael Bamford, Hernan Bernal, Seth Sims, Amanda Sue, Jorge Hernandez, Zoya Dimitrova, Armand Zakarian, Tatiana Chirkova, Irina Astrakhantseva, Pavel Skums, Olga Glebova, David Hinderer, Mason Wilde, Jared Strop, Craig McDaniel, Samuel Shepard, Ryan Brumbelaw, Christopher Laferty, Mike Yakubek and MARVIN (Mechanical Automaton of Randomly Valuable INtelligence).
Finally, special Thanks to Inna Rytsareva (Campaign management, IT and community outreach), Santiago Campo (audio and video production), Melinda McDaniel (video narration and rules proofreading),  and Tony Cha (rules proofreading).    
Juan Sebastian Romero: biologist, human rights defender, beloved friend. He was a brave, intelligent, selfless human being. I experienced first-hand the joy and curiosity of his noble nature while we studied Biology together. I remember vividly how happy he was when I gave him "The settlers of Catan" as a farewell gift. I miss you very much.

The Tiny Adventurers is a collection of soft enamel pins inspired by the classic RPG classes with a little twist, I don't think you'll find a cuter questing party out there (Apart from my Kobold Paladin)
This Kickstarter comes after the popularity of our last campaign that focused around the monster side of things, and now you can hire the adventurers to protect yourself from them! 

 We will be starting this campaign with The Wizard and Paladin pins as these have been voted as the most popular designs! Also i'm totally not biased as my main character is a wizard...
We have a total of 10 more pins to unlock during this campaign, The Bard, Druid, Ranger, Cleric, Warlock, Rogue, Barbarian, Monk, Sorcerer and Fighter. Who know's there might even be an Artificer and Dungeon master available if we beat these goals!
The pins are going for £7 early bird, £8 once we get passed the first 48 hours and then £9 when they find their way onto my Etsy store, so make sure to grab them as soon as you can!

campaign.story:
Roll Player Adventures is a cooperative storytelling board game for 1-4 players set in the world of the critically acclaimed dice manipulation game, Roll Player. Players take the role of fantasy heroes: facing challenges, adventuring through the realm of Ulos, and making decisions that change the story — and the kingdom — forever.
After a thousand years of peace, Dragul armies raided from the north, prompting you and every other loyal citizen of Nalos to sign up as soldiers of the King’s Guard. The armies of Nalos fought long and hard against the North’s monstrous generals and their minions, finally turning the tide of the Dragul Invasion.
In each of the game's 12 storybooks, you’ll be asked to make choices, complete skill checks, and fight battles that will permanently alter the world of Ulos for that adventure and in future adventures. You’ll find new allies, make enemies, and uncover secrets that will change the world around you.
Whatever choices you make, someone will remember — and respond.
Choose from one of 21 pregenerated characters, or import a favorite Roll Player character and take them on a heroic journey. Each character brings unique attributes, starting cards, class abilities, and backstories to your adventure.
Pregenerated Characters
Importing Characters from Roll Player
Roll Player Adventures does NOT require the Roll Player base game or any of its expansions to play, though it’s possible to import characters generated in Roll Player using any number of its expansions. Do you have a favorite Obnoxious Saurian Fighter who grew up as a Street Urchin from your last game of Roll Player? Bring them along
Each of the 17 races and 36 classes have unique portraits and class abilities in Adventures!
Convert your attribute scores and use them to build dice pools during your adventure!
Every market card from Roll Player has a new dice-manipulating counterpart in Roll Player Adventures!
 Note: Roll Player products will be available individually in the pledge manager.
Roll Player Adventures has 11 adventure books that form a continuous campaign, and 1 infinitely replayable sidequest that can be played at any time. In a session of Roll Player Adventures, you’ll explore a new area of the world of Ulos, represented by a unique adventure map. As your party travels around the map, you’ll read aloud from that adventure’s storybook and choose how you’ll approach each encounter.
During your adventure, you'll encounter strange creatures, solve puzzles and mysteries, and discover new areas of the map to explore.
Roll Player Adventures blends an immersive branching narrative with cooperative skill checks and combat encounters. These dice placement puzzles echo the satisfying, puzzle-solving features of other Thunderworks Games hits such as Roll Player and Cartographers: A Roll Player Tale. In each combat or skill check, players manage their resources to fill dice slots with dice of specific colors and numbers. With clever play and the players can attempt to overcome the obstacles on the path of adventure.

Spend stamina from your character’s attributes to add specific colors of dice to the dice pool: 
Then play cards from your hand to manipulate the dice and solve the puzzle:
If you lose a combat or fail a skill check, there’s no replaying a scenario or rolling up new characters. You now need to deal with the consequences of your failure, and see how the world changes in response. Even death is a new adventure — with its own 10-encounter storyline.
Roll Player Adventures has several systems dedicated to remembering the results of your actions. Together, they represent an incredible amount of responsiveness from the game world to player choices. Importantly, these systems also can interact with each other, giving nuance to relationships — you may choose to gain a temporary ally in an adventure, but be regarded by them differently because you’ve offended their faction in the past.
At the end of each adventure, you’ll spend your earned gold and experience points to advance your characters, improving your party for the next adventure. There are 100's of unique abilities to discover and many ways to specialize.
Want to try Roll Player Adventures for yourself? You can play through a draft of Adventure 1: Battle at Blacklake on both Tabletopia (Free!) and Tabletop Simulator. 
 Rahdo Runs Through - Runthrough
The Nefras's Judgement expansion is available as part of the Immortal Knight and World of Ulos pledge levels. In this expansion, Nefras, the Snake of Years, will judge each character in your party as they make personal choices that are woven through the storyline of your campaign. Uncover your backstory and choose your alignment in Roll Player Adventures: Nefras’s Judgement.
During a campaign including Nefras's Judgement, each character in your party plays through one unique backstory quest that spans across multiple adventure books.
For example, if a character in your party had a “Detective” Backstory, you might slowly uncover clues about a murder, scattered through the adventures in the main campaign, finally either solving the mystery or sending an innocent insectoid to Kulbak prison in the storyline's climax.
When setting up the Nefras’s Judgement expansion at the start of a Roll Player Adventures campaign, players can use the backstory provided with a pregenerated character, or they can import the backstory and alignment from a character built using Roll Player.
As with previous projects, we'll be shipping all pledge levels from reputable fulfillment partners around the world. This project is EU, UK, CA, and AU friendly. This means that rewards bound to those regions ship from within their respective regions so backers in those regions will not pay any VAT, customs, or duties on their games upon arrival at their address. Outside of these areas, we cannot guarantee friendly shipping.
    ------ PLEASE NOTE: SHIPPING IS NOT INCLUDED IN THE PLEDGE PRICE ------
Shipping will be charged in the pledge manager at the conclusion of this Kickstarter project based on pledge level and region. If you add additional items in the pledge manager, this may increase your shipping cost. We're offering a $10+ shipping subsidy to all backers from our actual shipping and VAT charges. See the chart below for estimated shipping costs based on region and pledge. 
Roll Player is a dice drafting, character creation game that has inspired an entire line of titles including two expansions to the core game and two additional games in the world of Ulos -- Cartographers & Lockup. Here's how you play!
The Thunderworks team has been working on this project for over three years. The scope is bigger and more ambitious than any project we've done in the past. It's a project born out of love for both narrative adventure games and the passion players have for the other games in the line. We are excited to bring such a big game to you from a small team.
But, printing a board game with a scope this large is expensive, and Thunderworks Games is a small company. Without the help of backers on Kickstarter, Roll Player Adventures simply will not exist.
We need your support to make this game a reality. The design is complete. The art is complete. Now, all we need is enough people who believe Roll Player Adventures is as cool and fun as we do to join us and make this game a reality!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every project has risks. I've outlined some common areas of risk in boardgame projects and how I've done my best to address them.

> Artwork: All the artwork for the game is complete, with the exception of any images added due to achieving stretch goals or any last minute tweaks before sending the final files off to the manufacturer.

>Development: All twelve books of Roll Player Adventures are complete and have been extensively playtested. We are currently playtesting the full campaign with final art and most of its graphic design to make sure everything is just right before we send the game into final layout for manufacturing.

> Component Quality: I've worked with and built a great relationship with one of the best game manufacturers around, Panda Game Manufacturing (www.pandagm.com). Their proven track record on games like Eclipse, Terra Mystica, Pandemic, Belfort, and Mice & Mystics, proves they make great games with a high standard to quality. They've printed all Thunderworks titles to date.

> Delivery Timeline: Unexpected delays out of my control can always occur (i.e. component shortage, manufacturer issues, customs delays, etc...). For the production schedule of Roll Player Adventures, I've used conservative estimates to account for unknowns and bumps in the road.

> Fulfillment: I have received multiple estimates and will be working with established fulfillment companies that have proven track records for delivering quickly and efficiently all over the world.

> Eighth Project: Even though this is my eighth Kickstarter project, I have continued to spend endless hours researching Kickstarter as well as participating in many Kickstarters. I have done my best to foresee and minimize any obstacles or stumbling blocks.

In addition, in my life outside of this campaign, I have over a decade of project management experience on large-scale software projects. I will continue to leverage that experience and apply it to this project by anticipating issues and sidestepping hurdles that may arise.

updates.update_userinfo: Three Steps Forwards and Two Steps Back (and an important question to all our backers)

updates.update_content:
Ready To Cross the Finish Line
We promised we wouldn't update you needlessly unless there were things that needed sharing, and we've tried to stick to that. As a result, things have been relatively quiet as we put the finishing touches on all our designs and waited for the printing process to conclude.

Hey, all! We just wanted to drop a quick note to let everyone know that the pledge manager will be closing at the end on the month (September 30th). There are still about 28% of you who have yet to fill it out, so we'd encourage you to get that taken care of as quickly as possible. Note, if you have a fluid housing situation or are experiencing emergency circumstances like many on the west coast, please please let us know if you can and we will make sure to work with you on whatever shipping solution is best for you. 
Pledge Manager closes September 30th

Hi, everyone! I know we've been quiet for a little while, but fortunately this is a case of "no news" being "good news." 
We are humming right along on production of the puzzle postcards (possibly even ahead of schedule!) and just want to share a brief update to let you know where everything is at. Here's a quick look at each facet of this project and where it currently sits:
MigratoryPatterns -- 100% complete. Product is printed and in our hands. 500 copies are already assembled.

Hey, everyone. This is just a quick note to let you know that I am about to push "send" to invite everyone over the PledgeManager for our campaign. For those who are new to all this, PledgeManager is a site that helps us organize everyone's info, allows people to add items as needed, and lets late backers trickle in until we close down. 
You should see an invite in your inbox or, possibly, spam folder, so keep an eye out for that. We'll likely have the PM open for at least a month, and we'll send out an update before we close it in case anyone needs to modify their shipping information.

And the Kickstarter is officially closed! I just wanted to make sure we took a moment to thank all of you for supporting us with Season 2. Despite this being our 4th Kickstarter campaign, in many ways it was very different, challenging, and surprising. We learned a lot that we will carry with us to our next project. 
In the meantime, we're hard at work on Season 2! Keep your eyes open for the invitation to the PledgeManager, which will be going out sometime in the next week, we anticipate. Here you can enter your shipping, edit your order, and add any additional items you want (like a box for Season 1 or the bonus art cards).

updates.update_userinfo: The Finish Line + a New Add-On!
updates.update_content:
As always, we'll keep this short so as not to bore you. 
We're dancing around 400 backers, which is great, and expect a fair few more before all is said and done on Tuesday. From when the campaign closes that day we have a few things to lock down with the pledge manager (we're using the original PledgeManager this time around) but you should be invited to provide your shipping information in the 1-2 weeks following.

We're on our way to 20k and getting closer to 400 backers! We've been hard at work on a lot of things behind-the-scenes, but today we want to give you a little look at one of the extra bits we decided to just include instead of making it a stretch goal: the bookmark. 
Many of you know that The Enigma Emporium has a little bookmark-slash-business-card that we slip into a lot of our outgoing orders. It's got our basic info on it, as well as a visual guide to a handful of commonly-used ciphers plus an easy alphanumeric reference. This started as just our spin on the common business card but quickly turned into a very popular piece and even one that was requested by folks who didn't receive one with their orders (which happened a lot due to different packaging and fulfillment processes).

campaign.story:
Update on VAT & Sales Taxes
We've spoken to 3 international region-friendly VAT/tax experts, and guess what? It's complicated, confusing, and all about to change in 2021 when our game ships and the tax assessments need to be made. Loopholes are closing, regulations are tightening, previous tax-minimization schemes are disappearing, but we can say we're happy to help out as much as possible. Here's how:
We will pay for any VAT / tax fees on any shipping charges. Backers will only pay required sales/VAT taxes for their Core or Deluxe game purchases (and any add-ons). This avoids the dreaded double-tax stack-up that many backers face when including shipping charges into the tax equation.
Retailers in the UK/EU: you may have to pay VAT on your 6-pack bundle, but this is a recoverable expense, and will also depend on whether your store and our chosen distribution partner's warehouse are located in the same country. We should have better information on that when the pledge manager opens and once our final EU/UK distribution partner is selected.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our team of creative professionals has combined decades of experience in developing products for mass production. Even though this may be our first tabletop game, we're being advised by some of the top leaders in the industry who have helped guide our every step. Of course, we're also using top-tier manufacturing and fulfillment partners. 

That said, we live in a dynamic world which is currently being tested like never before. Changes in manufacturing partners, paper costs, shipping fluctuations, global economics: all can affect our final outcome and schedule. But be confident that all issues that may arise during our development process, from schedule delays to component quality, will be quickly and clearly shared with our backers via frequent updates. We're in this together now!

DISCLAIMER: as we continue to develop the game for mass-production, the artwork, components, names, and likenesses shown in the above illustrations are subject to change.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
By having a highly expandable and upgrade-able game system, The Shivers will always be new and evolving. The game has an intrinsic quality that will last through generations, not a quick fad that gets played a couple times then sits on a shelf (or worse, goes into the trash).
Sustainable materials
Our paper pop-up constructions and manuals will use FSC-type paper certified by FSC (Forest Stewardship Council), which ensures proper sustainable forest management is used to harvest trees for paper.
Environmentally friendly factories
Our pop-up manufacturing factory is accredited by FSC.org to ensure sustainable forestry and conservation practices to support their paper supply chain.
Something else
Our unique Story Card system of creating new episodes allows for players to print episodes on their own home printers (this functionality will be enabled on future expansions). This means no burden to supply chain or environmental impact from international shipping, as printing of new episodes will be on-demand, local, and with much less environmental impact.

campaign.story:
COLOR SPRAY DICE - Project Overview
We're proud to announce the launch of our Color Spray Dice Series to the Kickstarter community.  We're making this dice collection available in lots of color schemes, with many font colors to choose from, and in some fantastic configurations - regardless of your preferred gaming system.
These 16mm plastic polyhedral dice feature our Signature Font which has a unique look with a bold print that's not only good looking, but they are also easy to read.
PLAY

COLOR VARIATIONS AND SIGNATURE FONT
We've developed a large color assortment for this project, and we're happy to announce the availability of 20 unique color and font combinations.  As colors are unlocked, each color and numbering configuration will be available in all collections shown below. 
LAUNCH DETAILS
Upon reaching our launch goal, we will be unlocking 4 varieties of our Color Spray Dice:
Red Color Spray with Black Numbering
Red Color Spray with Silver Numbering
Blue Color Spray with Black Numbering
Blue Color Spray with White Numbering
Multi Color Spray with Black Numbering
At launch, and as more color varieties are unlocked, these dice will be available as single dice, 7 piece sets, 11 piece sets, and in 10 count matching collections by dice size (D20, D12, D10, D8, D6, D4, and D00).
Red Color Spray Dice with Black Numbering
Red Color Spray Dice with Silver Numbering
Blue Color Spray Dice with Black Numbering
Blue Color Spray Dice with White Numbering
Multi Color Spray Dice with Black Numbering
LIMITLESS CUSTOMIZATION
With this project, any imaginable color combination is available to our backers as varieties are unlocked.  Maybe you want to build a custom dice set for your characters, or maybe you need a unique color combination for your RPG system.  No matter the uniqueness, we can provide a custom dice collection that meets your exact needs.
For example, if you like the Red Color Spray Set with Black Font, but you want to add three D20 dice in the Blue Color Spray with White Font, you will want to select the reward for your dice set, then add on $6 for the three additional single dice ($2 each).
If you want a truly mixed and matched collection, choose the single dice reward, and multiply the number of dice in your collection by $2.  For example, if you want to build a custom 20 piece collection, you'll want to pledge $40 ($2 per die) under the Single Die Reward.

7 AND 11 PIECE COLLECTIONS
7 Piece Dice Sets - $10 each
11 Piece Dice Sets - $14 each


TEN COUNT MATCHING DICE COLLECTIONS 
Ten Count Pack of Matching D20 Dice - Any Unlocked Color Variety
Ten Count Pack of Matching D12 Dice - Any Unlocked Color Variety
Ten Count Pack of Matching D10 Dice - Any Unlocked Color Variety
Ten Count Pack of Matching D8 Dice - Any Unlocked Color Variety
Ten Count Pack of Matching D6 Dice - Any Unlocked Color Variety
Ten Count Pack of Matching D4 Dice - Any Unlocked Color Variety
Ten Count Pack of Matching D00 Dice - Any Unlocked Color Variety
WOODEN DICE DISPLAY AND STORAGE BOXES - LIMITED AVAILABILITY
Good news backers!  We're going to launch some brand new wooden dice display and storage boxes for this campaign.  Check out the rewards for this project to get your hands on these new cases at a great value.
Our wooden dice display and storage boxes are solid wooden cases that include a magnetized lid that closes tightly and fits perfectly.  For this project, cases are available in 4 designs, or you can choose to have a case with no engraved design.  After choosing your design, backers will be able to choose from 6 available wood types.

STRETCH GOALS



ADD ON ITEMS
8 Inch Dice Tray - Wizard Hat Design with Prism Multi-Color Foil
8 Inch Dice Tray - Wizard Hat Design with Blue Foil
8 Inch Dice Tray - Wizard Hat Design with Purple Foil
Leather Lite Dice Display and Storage Case - Multi Color Wizard Hat Design with 7 and 11 Piece Foam Inserts
Leather Lite Dice Display and Storage Case - Purple Wizard Hat Design with 7 and 11 Piece Foam Inserts
Leather Lite Dice Display and Storage Case - Blue Wizard Hat Design with 7 and 11 Piece Foam Inserts
Leather Lite Dice Display and Storage Case - Raven Design with 7 and 11 Piece Foam Inserts
Leather Lite Dice Display and Storage Case - Cthulhu Design with 7 and 11 Piece Foam Inserts
Leather Lite Dice Display and Storage Case - Wolf Design with 7 and 11 Piece Foam Inserts
SHIPPING DETAILS
Shipping charges for all items will be charged after the campaign during the survey process.  We will be using a third-party system  (Backerkit) for this project to manage the survey process at the conclusion on this campaign.  All shipping charges will be weight-based given your finalized order, including any add-on items you choose to add.  All shipping will go through the USPS using their standard Retail Ground service.
If you would like to estimate your shipping costs, please use the USPS Retail Postage Price Calculator.  Shipments will originate from the zip code 43019, and you should choose the option to calculate shipping charges based on "Shape and Size".
The second step of this estimation process will allow you to enter the estimated weight of your shipment.  Please use the table below to estimate the total weight of your shipment.  After entering the weight, please choose the "Package" option to complete the estimation tool on the USPS website.
