campaign.story:
Full Deck is an immersive, three-book escape puzzle collection, where you use a book of evidence, a serial killer's diary and a lone cop's sleep journal to piece together the  puzzles and mysteries contained within. 
Estimated total playing time: 10-12 hours!
For four long days in 2020, a serial killer terrorised a sleepy provincial town in England, and appeared to always be one step ahead of the Police. In order to fully close this case, the Police have now released three items, containing over 90 puzzles and mysteries, and are calling on you to help solve them...
 You can play Full Deck several ways:
Backing BOOKSHELF, which includes all three books
Backing ONLOOKER (digital) or CRIME BOARD (physical), which is a self-contained puzzle
Bookshelf 
Three distinct books make up the Full Deck set.
This  is a collection of three books, each set inside a crime narrative, where you have to piece together the clues and solve the 90 puzzles contained within.
The books consist of:  
A full-colour textured paperback book
Masterpiece - Released by the Police, this is a facsimile copy of the serial killer's diary. Read through the diary and see if you can uncover their motivation, plans and other nefarious ideas. The diary is written in broken prose, so you will need to have your most cryptic, riddling minds active to solve the challenges contained within.  
54 images of crucial evidence to solve the case.
Evidence - 54 specific items of interest to the Police, from ticket stubs to menu orders and receipts. This is a self-contained puzzle book, as each item also gives clues to a specific playing card value and suit. The items contribute heavily to the storyline, and will give valuable clues to solving the other puzzles.
The Evidence book also has answer grids. The Full Deck series uses a brand new answer validation system (BinCheck), so you will not need access to a computer to see if you are correct. This book will be fully printed in colour.
If you'd like to have have the actual pieces of evidence, please look at our Crime Board or Expert Reward. 
A full colour, glossy journal.
Redacted - A facsimile of the journal kept by the investigating Police Officer during the event. The pages have been written in detail, but you will need your powers of deduction (as well as some cross-referencing) in order to work out the information which has been redacted by the Police, for fear of reprisals or lawsuits. This book will be fully printed in colour.   
 Want to play the standalone game, with 54 pieces of facsimile evidence? Dust off your cork board, get your pins ready, and take a look at our Crime Board Reward...
 Crime Board 
54-pieces of facsimile evidence, from tickets stubs to crucial ephemera.
Also available is Crime Board. This is a physical collection of all the items of evidence, complete in a genuine evidence bag. Now is your chance to recreate your own crime board, by using these tickets, leaflets, photographs and receipts to build either a timeline of the events, or connect them together as a standalone puzzle.
Crime Board has a game built into it - each of the 54 items has a playing card suit and value hidden within it, so can be played either on it's own (find all the playing cards), or as part of the Full Deck game (for example, seeking out a name that visited a specific location from one of the pieces of evidence).
Some of the Crime Board elements in action!
Please note that the items in Crime Board are the same as those in the Evidence book, but we believe these add an exciting element to the game, and are perfect for a group of detectives to work through together! Below are some ways backers could play Crime Board:
Those with books might find the places items are mentioned at or hinted towards, and put them in those sections of the book.
Blu-tack a deck of cards on the wall, and see if you can place the right item on the right playing card (good for sifting evidence).
"Borrow" a rolling whiteboard from work and create a visual timeline.
Clear the table, and have friends over to sift and sort the clues, uncovering all the puzzles (remember, this is a standalone game, AND can be used with the books).
Reward Options 
For those on a budget, we are offering a digital-only copy of Evidence. If you love the idea of being your own detective, we are offering Crime Board, which is a physical collection of the evidence, supplied in a genuine evidence bag. For booklovers, you can back to get either the three copies on their own (Bookshelf Pledge), or you can upgrade to the Expert pledge, which includes all three books AND the Crime Board reward. Lastly, we have an extremely limited number of naming rewards available. Please note that these prices are below eventual retail prices.
Background
This has been created by Stephen, one half of The Escapages, publishers of Escape Books. We have published eight books so far, the most recent one, Flatpak, being successfully funded on Kickstarter in 2019. Flatpak was an interactive puzzle escape book in the guise of a furniture catalogue, and the full-colour print contained over 120 puzzles. 
"As a lifelong fan of crime fiction and drama, I have always been most interested in the little details; the crime board of evidence, the whiteboard timelines, the little baggies of clues, the serial killer's diary. I felt that there was an extraordinary opportunity to build a pacy narrative simply by using these materials alone. The result is this; an incredibly complex intertwining set of storylines, combined with photorealistic detail and some deliciously-challenging puzzles."
See Stephen talk about Escapages and the Full Deck project here (18 minute video).
Solve the riddles within the diary to help crack the case.
Details
How will the puzzles work?
There are three distinct types of puzzle included in Full Deck, outlined below. They are are ordered by difficulty, starting with the easiest.
Evidence - In this book are photographs of 54 key pieces of evidence from the Full Deck crime story. Contained within each item is a clue or hint toward an ordinary playing card suit and value - including two jokers.
Redacted - This book is the sleep journal of the investigating Police Officer, which has been check through by the Crown Prosecution Service, and key elements of the story have been redacted. The puzzles within this book rely on you drawing information from the journal itself, and Masterpiece.
Masterpiece - our killer wrote his plans and thoughts in prose, list, diagrams and poetry. You will have to dig through the book, sometimes linking information from Evidence and Redacted, in order to solve the riddles and puzzles contained within.
The journal will guide you, if you can only solve the redacted sections...
Schedule
To avoid any disappointment, we have created a schedule with enough breathing space to allow for any unforeseen minor delays, as outlined below. We aim to complete different milestones ahead of this, but hope that this gives some idea of what we are working toward.
August - October 2020 Completion of the text for Masterpiece and Redacted.
October 2020 Generation of the BinCheck grids. First Play test round.
November 2020 Typesetting of all three books.
December 2020 Printing of proof copies.
January 2021 Professional copy editing and proofreading. Play testing.
February 2021 Revisions made. Shipping costs and addresses confirmed.
March 2021 Worldwide dispatch.

Stretch Goals
We have built two complimentary products for Full Deck - the books, and the crime board set. Below are the stretch goals for them both:
As you can see, there are dedicated upgrades for both the books and the crime board. Please bear in mind that if you pledge at EXPERT level, you are contributing to scores for both! If someone backs just the books, that is added to the Bookshelf tally, and so on.
At the time of writing, we are already over halfway to our first Stretch Goal for both, so please read below to see how we can achieve this faster than you might expect.
We are trying something a little different for this campaign, and asking you to really help get the word out about this project on Social Media. To that end, we have built in a Sharing Stretch range of rewards too!
All you have to do is share the above link (bit.ly/BackFullDeck), and we will do the rest. Every validated click counts, and will earn more puzzles for the book set. Plus, if/when we reach 2,000 validated clicks, we will include a customised pin badge for all physical backers!
If you have a large fanbase online and would like a customised bit.ly link, please do get in touch via our messages, and we can provide one bespoke for you. Please get in touch for more details.

Shipping
Please note that shipping is not included in your pledge, and will instead by charged after the campaign using a pledge manager. There will be the option of standard or tracked shipping. Shipping is likely to be around £6 domestically, and £10 internationally, and will be calculated near to dispatch based on current rates and accurate weights. This shipping cost will not include any local taxes or import duties.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Full Deck set of puzzles have already been play tested extensively using followers on our social media channels, the plot is fully designed and major elements of been written. Due to the challenges of COVID, we have put March 2021 as the completion date of the project, though we have planned a schedule that completes in advance of this. The experience of writing six puzzle books already, combined with successful work with play testers, proof readers and printers enables us to be confident in delivering a high quality and fascinating project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We will use high quality finish on our products that will make you proud to have them on your shelf.
Reusability and recyclability
We are utilising packaging where possible to become part of the final project. All materials will be recycled where possible.
Environmentally friendly factories
Our printer only uses environmentally certified and recycled materials. The wraparound packaging used for shipping is fully recyclable.
Sustainable Distribution
We promise to explore country-centred fulfilment, dependent on the volume of sales in key countries.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our seventh Kickstarter and with Six successful Kickstarters under our belt, so we are well versed with Kickstarter ways and envisage no problems. Other than this we have collaborated with dozens of Kickstarters during these last two years. Providing models all round to community members in some of the most popular campaign offered in Digtal on Kickstarter.

All Core models have already been created and will be delivered directly after the Kickstarter end, when payment is received. So no waiting more than necessary for your core files. All Stretch Goals have also been completed, but need to be tested and will be available shortly after that.

DIGITAL MEDIA:
We strive to produce models that will print with as little support and parts as possible. Some models print in one go whilst most are split up into parts which must be printed separately and then assembled.

The file format of choice will be .STL and the models shall be zipped and made available to the user for download. The user is responsible for downloading their product and must have a valid internet connection and email with which to collect their reward, via internet download. We will keep the files on our system for at least three months after the first date of issue. The user must ensure that he collects the files within this time frame or risk forfeit. Lovecraft will always try their utmost to ensure that you receive your files and we hope that you enjoy printing them as much as we have enjoyed creating them. If there are any issues please contact support@i-lovecraft.com

Backers must realize that the resolution you obtain on your print is down to the system you use. Our high resolution files will give you almost render quality prints on high end Resin machines, whilst the same files will produce lesser resolution prints on standard FDM printers. At any rate, the files have been previously tested on Resin and FDM printers and have shown satisfactory produce.

We recommend FDM Prints with at least a 400micron nozzle and 150 micron layer height for terrain. A 100 micron layer height will give you outstanding prints all round.

Resin printers should have no problems obtaining excellent resolution and finish, even at 100 micron layer height although 50 micron layer height is recommended for minute sculpt detail clarity. Although miniatures and figurines can be split into smaller parts, large terrain pieces will require a standard 220x220mm print bed, standard for FDM Printers like the 'Ender3'. We do try to restrict the maximum size of models to 180mm sq where possible.

We supply the user with a design that has been tested on conventional home hobby printers and is proven to print.

All the models are tested and sliced with 'Cura' software which is freeware and available to all backers for use. We recommend that backers use 'Cura' as it is fully tested with our models and we can offer customer support, if any problems are encountered. We are unable to give customer support for other slicing software and backers use this at their own risk.

All the files have been checked using Netfab, this means that PrusaSlicer should have no problems slicing these files. Many of the files are also tested using PrusaSlicer.

All accumulated Grab Bag, Bonus models, also known as Daily Bonus or Free Models are given freely, under no obligation, as is and as a gift and don't form part of the campaign or responsibilities associated with this.

When using our digital media, we do not hold ourselves responsible for the production or manufacturing process of the design, this is exclusively up to the user.

Users may modify models and files at their own risk and only for their own personal use. Modified files are not guaranteed by us and as such, users do this under their own risk and know how.

The Images shown on the campaign page are just for visualization and although they may come very close, they may not be an exact representation of the final design or printed model, which may vary.

We reserve the right to alter any of the models shown, at any time, before delivery, with the intent of improving the design, or efficiency of production.

campaign.story:
VALLIS MORTIS, the valley of the dead, is the campaign world created by Fat Dragon Games founder Tom Tullis over 35 years ago. Starting with this Kickstarter, and continuing with future campaigns, locations in this setting will be brought to life as richly detailed 3D printable models, and an accompanying pdf will feature information on each location as it is released, including designer notes and development history over the years. This Kickstarter will feature locations such as the village of Dragonshire, excursions into the depths of Shadowgrove, unholy shrines deep within Vallis Mortis, the wight infested barrows of Barrowdeep, and much more! 
DRAGONLOCK™ is an interlocking terrain system that allows you to create fully modular, multi-level 28mm scale village terrain for your RPG or wargame on your home 3D printer. Each set is delivered in a downloadable .stl format via our online distribution partner DriveThruRPG.com, and once you have the set, you can print as many pieces as you like and never run out or need to purchase more. These terrain sets represent the culmination of over fifteen years of gaming terrain design experience.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Fat Dragon Games is a small company, and we need to be careful what subjects we choose to proceed with for production. One or two poorly selling sets could hurt our company severely. By putting potential projects up on Kickstarter, we can be sure if there is demand for that subject before devoting our resources to it. We also get to connect directly with our customers, rewarding those who are early supporters for a set with cool stuff like exclusive pieces not available to customers who purchase the set later on, and free stretch rewards. We have been in the print-and-play terrain business for over 15 years, having released more than 200 terrain sets, and have had ten previous Kickstarter campaigns successfully funded and delivered so supporters of this project can feel completely confident in our ability to deliver a high-quality product as promised.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Our clip system was specifically designed to put all stress and wear on the tiny clip itself, not the terrain piece, so the terrain models will last an incredibly long time after years of use with no degradation of the clip port that would result in loosening of the fit.
Reusability and recyclability
The PLA plastic the end user will utilize to create these models at home can be broken down in an industrial composter as it is a bioplastic made from plants.
Sustainable materials
We only recommend the use of renewable bioplastics in the 3D printing process like PLA (Poly Lactic Acid) which is made from corn or sugar cane plants (thus not using oil like other plastics) and is a renewable resource.
Environmentally friendly factories
Since our product is produced by the consumer at home on a 3D printer, there is no factory required for the creation of these models. This eliminates the extensive amount of fossil fuels normally utilized in the mass production of products like this such as steel mold creation (large carbon footprint in the manufacturing of the steel) and the oil used in the injection molding process, plus shipping of final product is eliminated as well saving fuel and eliminating the carbon emissions of both container ships and land-based shipping trucks.
Sustainable Distribution
Fulfillment is digital, thus eliminating all carbon footprints related to the trans-oceanic and over-land shipment associated with physical products.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
• Production
Production is partially handled in-house (yes, we are control freaks) but more complex elements are being manufactured by print professionals. We're working hard to make sure that all components appear the same as shown in the prototype images. Please note that due to material availability and manufacturing processes, you may still see a slight difference (i.e. color saturation, paper texture.)
All the web components of the games are being hosted securely and all have backups, so you shouldn't worry about not being able to access them in the foreseeable future.

• Art & Design
We're actively working on the creative part of Chapter One. To make sure there are no delays on the creative front, we've decided not to wait until the end of the campaign and we've already hired the illustrator & extra writing staff. If we reach certain stretch goals, there may be additional artwork to produce, but we don’t foresee this causing any delays.

• Shipping
We are planning to begin the shipping process immediately following the end of the campaign. We're doing our best to subsidize your shipping costs as much as we can, even if it means covering the whole fee for the package for Journey backers in USA & Canada and most of the shipping fee for the EU.
Delivering hundreds of envelopes around the world is not an easy task, and we all understand there are many factors that could cause delays. This is why our biggest pledge for all 13 games offers most of the games to be shipped in one box. This way we majorly reduce the chances of one of your 13 envelopes to be lost, damaged, or delayed when sent as a letter mail.
Please note that if you're outside of US & Canada and you add the "Almost Subscription" add-on that offers all your 13 envelopes to be shipped separately, the shipping will be considered to be “at your own risk”, meaning we cannot be responsible for mishandled packages.
Any issues with delivery will be handled individually and in-house. We're prepared to send replacements when it makes sense.

• Additional Fees & Customs
One of the reasons we're heavily subsidizing our shipping costs is because VAT, customs, or other local shipping fees are unfortunately not covered and processed on our end. We currently have only twenty EU & Asian backers, so we are prepared to serve you personally and case by case.
To be more accessible for International backers of all 13 games, we added the "Almost Subscription" add-on that offers all your 13 envelopes to be shipped as letter mail, not in a box. According to our research, letter mail is exempt from VAT in most countries, so we're hoping this option will help you save some $.

• Refunds
As of launch, we haven't found any pledge managers for post-campaign processing we're happy with, so we'll be handling everything in-house.
You are welcome to manage your pledge during the campaign (we really hope that 40 days are enough for you to make a final decision and we will make sure to send an update 48/24h before the end of the campaign to remind you to manage your pledge.) Once the campaign ends, we will send out final surveys and we will start the shipping process immediately. Once your order has been processed for shipping, we will no longer be able to offer refunds. 

• Unforeseen Events
While we can't anticipate everything, we feel that we are prepared to deal with all the issues if and when they occur. We are committed to you all and will always keep you updated about any changes that might affect this project. We respect our backers and we have a moral obligation to ensure everyone receives what they pledged for. By pledging to this project, you are indicating that you understand and give consent to the risks, challenges, and pledge terms laid out above. Thank you for your support, we are excited to share this project with everyone!

campaign.story:
Yes, 100%.
The Backekit Pledge Manager will be open to late pledges shortly after the close of the campaign.  Click the big button at the very top of the page to get connected.  It might put you on our mailing list for when we announce it, or bring you right to the Backerkit late-pledge store, depending on timing.    That button is your key to unlocking the Mystery!
Thank you for your interest in Gate Keeper Games and our dice!
Let’s unlock the Mystery!
ALL STRETCH GOALS UNLOCKED!
There are currently...
50 brand new dice sets unlocked (pic & details below)
7 Weird Stuff unlocked (pic & details below)
5 d2s unlocked (pics & details below)
UK & EU VAT Friendly Shipping (details below)
A free shipping box upgrade! (details below) 

What are Mystery Dice?
Over the last 7 years I've produced over 90 custom dice designs.  I'm really proud of that work.  But my supporters have put a bug in me: They want me to make All The Things!  ...now I do too.
So here's the plan.  We set a funding goal of $25,000 together.  That allows us, you and me, to make 10 totally new dice designs.  Never before seen things.  Insane quality designs, even better than you know to expect from me. 
But that's all I'm gonna tell you!
How's it work?
You pledge for dice sets at an immense discount, and we make and ship them to you as a "Mystery Set".  Meaning we don't tell you what you're getting, you find out ...when you open the box!
Endless surprises await as every set you add to your pledge is guaranteed to be unique, with no repeats unless you ask for them.  It's going to be an unboxing experience like no other!
What might we make?
There might be new molds, new sizes, new colors, new patterns, opaque and transparent.  There might be sparkles, neon, glow in the dark, layers and swirls, inclusions... or maybe even all of the above at once! 
Anything goes!  We're putting no limits on ourselves! 
I promise this: 
All 7-die and 11-die sets will be the polyhedral shapes you expect, and they'll have the numbers you expect.  All the rest...?  That's where the fun happens!
 Our first 10 sets are out of Dice Jail, and ready to be added to your pledge!
At funding, $25,000, we released ten (10) sets for your enjoyment.
Then, every $5,000 in funding past the initial funding goal we've unlocked another set for "as long as that model holds".  That is: 11 sets at $30,000, 12 sets at $35,000, etc. All the way up through 25 sets unlocked at $100,000.  Now that we're at 25 sets, 2d2s, and 4 Weird Stuff that model needs to be adjusted slightly.
Now, every $10,000... in funding past $100,000 in funding we'll unlock yet another set until the end of the campaign.
ALL STRETCH GOALS UNLOCKED!
To keep things simple, we'll have one ever-changing "Stretch Goal" image below.
Total Sets Unlocked: 50! The final total! Everything's unlocked!!! : D


Via your awesome support you have more than QUADRUPLED the original set quantity release!  That is truly awesome.  There are no chains on the options.  Let's make "all the things"!
7-Die and 11-Die Sets*
All unlocked sets above will be available as 7-die and 11-die set options, with standard numerals for normal play.
7-die sets: $9 per set.  (40% off average MSRP of $15)
Each 7-die set contains: 1d4, 1d6, 1d8, 1d10, 1d%, 1d12, and 1d20.
  11-die sets: $14 per set.  (40% off average MSRP of $23)
Each 11-die set contains: 1d4, 4d6, 1d8, 1d10, 1d%, 1d12, and 2d20.
  The 3 extra d6 are great for all your backstabbery needs, and the extra d20 is perfect for Advantage/Disadvantage.
  *We reserve the right to add free stuff to any dice set at any time.  - We've already applied free upgrades to 4 different sets.  More are likely.
Plus we've got: Weird Stuff! 
Yup, we've got Weird Stuff too!
We made the first one available at funding, and through Daily Puzzle Challenge submissions we've unlocked more!
To keep things simple here too, we'll have one ever-changing "Weird Stuff" unlock image below.
Total Weird Stuff Unlocked: 7!

Wait... "Weird Stuff"!?
Not everything we want to do fits the traditional mold.  Literally and figuratively.  Therefore, in addition to the main unlocked sets, we'll occasionally add a totally new, totally different "Weird Stuff" option to the campaign.  
Add a "Weird Stuff" item to any pledge tier for: $24 each.  At funding there was only one, but now there's more, and we'll unlock even more still as we go!  Therefore the same No-Duplicates guarantee applies when you add more than 1 to your pledge.
What will they be like?
Weird.  I promise one thing and one thing only: They'll technically count as 'dice' and be well worth your money.  Beyond that, anything goes here!
They may or may not be: extra large or small sizes, over-full sets, special single dice, new materials, unusual numerals, odd molds, and all manner of chaos.
We're giving away zero other details here. : )
Let me be clear: you do not want to miss these! 
New Weird Stuff will unlock and be added as often as we think is good.  Sometimes with Daily Puzzle submissions (a community building must-see below), sometimes with funding, sometimes because I had a cool idea.  : ) They'll never take away from normal set unlocks above.
Plus! For breaking $300,000:
I'm going to upgrade the shipping box.  It's small little thing I've got in mind, especially as compared to the bajillion sets of dice inside of it, but I believe it'll increase your pleasure in even receiving your box ...and that for me is reason enough to do it.  
"What is it?"  ...It's a Mystery! : )
Always loving to work together with others in this great gaming community, we invited the following people / organizations to Guest Design a Mystery Set.  It's our way of bringing people together.  Their brains design it, our hands make it.  Honestly, it's a lot of fun!
We've unlocked ALL of the Guest Designer Dice!  
Ten traditional sets, and two "Weird Stuff" from Jamey Stegmaier and Norse Foundry! 
Newest Addition: YOU!  We've named you, the Kickstarter Backers, the final Guest Designer on the campaign!  Post your suggestion in the comments.  Vote up suggestions by commenting on them.  From the top 10 ideas chosen by you, I'll secretly select the final winner at the close of the campaign!  
Guest designers were given free reign to design a set as they see fit, with no real design limitations.
The following guidelines were given: It must be a new set nobody's ever done before in design and/or colors, it must have standard numerals on all faces*, and you can't tell anyone what it looks like till it ships.  ...naturally.
*We have allowed the two dice groups, if they want to, to put their group's symbol/logo on the d20 and/or d6 (not all have accepted or even decided).  We leave it to them.
We only have one add on option, and that's our all new custom d2 design, created just for this campaign.  During the course of the campaign, we will unlock additional d2 coins as add ons.
There are currently: FIVE designs available...
First d2 Option:
#1) You may add the Campaign-Exclusive "Mystery Die d2" to any Pledge Tier for only $2/per. No limit.
Size: Approx 25mm across, 5mm thick.
Renders shown. Final design may vary.
New D2 Option! 
Unlocked for Making this the best GKG Campaign of all time!
#2) You may add the Campaign-Exclusive "Best Kickstarter Ever d2" to any Pledge Tier for only $2/per. No limit.
Render Shown. Final design may vary.

3rd D2 Option!
Unlocked for submitting 1750 correct puzzle submissions!
#3) You may add the "Decision Maker" to your pledge for only $2/per.  No limit.
Color Scheme chosen by the backers: "Blazing Red and Free as the Sky Blue"
Render Shown. Final design may vary.
4th D2 Option!
Unlocked because you're awesome!
#4) The "Sun & Moon" d2!  You are welcome to add "Sun & Moon" d2s to your pledge for only $2/per.  No limit.
Possible uses for the Sun & Moon d2:
Day or Night
Light or Darkness
Good Effect or Bad Effect
Good Mood or Bad Mood (for random NPCs encountered)
Yes or No
Win or Lose
Life or Death
Final D2 Option!
"The Gate Keeper"
#5) Added on the final day to celebrate how amazing you all are.  This coin will likely become the icon of the GKG d2 line, and you'll be the first to own one.  Featuring our GKG invented color (sorta, but yes, but not really, buy heck yes), 'Power Teal'.   You are welcome to add "The Gate Keeper" d2s to your pledge for only $2/per.  No limit.
Render Shown. Final design may vary.
We've got just two Pledge Tiers: 
 The Grab Bag, for 7-die sets
 The Mystery Box, for 11-die sets
Pledging is easy!
Want 7-die sets?  Choose "The Grab Bag" and pledge $9 for each 7-die set you want.
Want 11-die sets?  Choose "The Mystery Box" and pledge $14 for each 11-die set you want.
Want to add the Weird Stuff?  Simply add $24 for each Weird Stuff option you want, to ANY pledge tier.  Yes, you may add multiples/duplicates.
Want to add special d2s?  Simply add $2 for each d2 you want, to ANY pledge tier.  Yes, you may add multiples/duplicates.  
Weird Stuff and D2s do not count toward free shipping but will be included in free shipping if you have 3 or more normal sets in your pledge.
Mix and Match?
Yes, you can mix-and-match adding 7-die or 11-die sets along with Weird Stuff and d2s to ANY pledge tier, as freely as you like by pledging for the correct totals.  We'll clarify exactly what your pledge value is for in Backerkit during Pledge Management.
NO DUPLICATE GUARANTEE:
All sets in your order will be unique; there will be no repeat/duplicate sets in your order.  So if you want all of them you are guaranteed all of them if you pledge for all of them.  If you DO want duplicates, you can A) Ask for them in Backerkit, or B) Pledge for more total sets than are offered.
 Wait, are you not going to show us the dice...? 
Naturally, because this is a Mystery Dice Campaign, to show you the sets would remove the Mystery!  Dice included will not be revealed until they ship to you this fall. But we're so confident in our quality, that we guarantee you'll like them!  Details on guarantees below.
New Daily Puzzle Challenge every day of the campaign!
Solve the puzzle below, email your answer to us for a chance to unlock additional sets, Weird Stuff, new d2 coin options, or upgrade existing sets!  We may even give away other bonuses.  Shhh...
Wonderful Wednesday! - The Final Puzzle!
Puzzle submissions are closed at the close of the campaign, because we've already unlocked all the things! : )
**Please do NOT put the answer, hints, or tips in the public comments or on social media.**
Tomorrow's may be a riddle, a visual puzzle, matchstick math... anything's possible!
A simple honor policy: If you google for an answer please don't submit.  Thank you.
Solutions for previous day's Daily Puzzle Challenge announced in comments daily.
 Daily Puzzle Unlocks so far: 
 200 submitted correct answers: Now Unlocked! Our 2nd "Weird Stuff", designed by Jamey Stegmaier with a "Rolling Realms" theme.
 500 submitted correct answers: Now Unlocked! FREE DICE! - I'm going to choose 3 sets, one will get +1d4, one will get +1d6, and and one will get +1d8.  I figure this will help Monks, Rogues, and Paladins respectively!  Thus the 7-die set of that type will become an 8-die set for free, and the 11-die set just became a 12-die set!  Maybe you'll get lucky and fetch one of these sets in your glorious Unboxing!  ...I told you "I reserve the right to add free stuff to any set at any time", didn't I?
 1000 submitted correct answers: Now Unlocked! - A new "Weird Stuff" Guest Designed by our friends at Norse Foundry!  The theme is still TBD, but we'll let you know as soon as we do!
 1750 submitted correct answers: Now Unlocked! - The ultimate d2 with it's colors selected by the community "The Decision Maker".  Now found in the Add-Ons section above.
 2500 submitted correct answers: Now Unlocked! - A new Weird Stuff has be added as our final Puzzle Submission unlock!
We believe in our dice, and we believe in you.  We stand by everything on this campaign with the following 3 guarantees.
Guarantee #1) No Duplicates: There will be no repeat sets in your order unless you specifically ask for them or if you pledge for more sets than we've unlocked.
Guarantee #2) Quality Promise: After receiving your Mystery Dice, we're going to give you 14 whole days to play with them, and play with them you should! If you discover any quality issues, what-so-ever, we'll gladly replace your set or give you your money back, 100%.  Quality promise applies to all reward items; and "Quality promise" shipping is on us.
Guarantee #3) Like Em, or Send Em Back: (LEOSEB) We're going to try new things, but have no intention of making ugly dice.  We're so certain they'll be gorgeous that if after receiving your Mystery Dice if you actually don't like them, for personal aesthetic reasons, we'll allow you to send sets back to us for a free Mystery replacement.  LEOSEB applies to normal sets only (7-die & 11-die), but due to the inherent weirdness-factor of Weird Stuff it does not apply to those items, or any d2 add ons.  To ensure this is a promise we can keep, all LEOSEB shipping will be the responsibility of the backer.  
Shipping should be simple, and the unboxing experience should be exciting!
It's flat rate.  No guessing, no games.  We're covering all weight upgrade costs for you world-wide. 
We're offering to pay for your shipping in the USA.  Doesn't get easier than "Free". : )
We're covering all VAT charged in the UK, EU, and Canada.  Doesn't get any better than duty-free!
VAT pre-paid and shipped directly to your door! No customs, no fees. I'm going to cover them for you personally.
Shipping fees, where applicable, will be collected after the campaign during Pledge Management in Backerkit. Note: Currently, Kickstarter has applied a $15 shipping fee for ALL international backers at the time of pledging. We've been working with Kickstarter to help us resolve it but they're unable to help.  Please know that this is ok, and we'll get it sorted in the Backerkit. For backers in the EU and "Worldwide" the small price difference will be collected after the campaign in the pledge manager.
For additional details on EU shipping, and a cost break down, I welcome you to please check out the FAQ tab.  Thank you.
Please note, to ensure our "no duplicates" policy is correctly applied, that our "Like em or Send em Back" policy can rightly occur, and to be able to offer Free Shipping in the USA, most fulfillment will be handled in house by me personally!  : )  In the UK and EU we'll be shipping from inside so that you don't have any VAT or import fees!
Beyond these locations some countries may be responsible for customs or import fees.  You can calculate the estimated fees for your country here.  Import fees are usually 8%-20% of your total pledge value, while some countries do not charge fees for "toys & games" which our dice count as.  We believe our exceptional dice and shipping costs should help to offset some customs fees.  -  You are our first priority!
Brought to you by:
"These are your dice!"

campaign.story:
What is The Emerald Flame? 
Hours of puzzles with an interwoven narrative packed into a beautifully illustrated tabletop game. 
Like a blend of escape rooms, board games, and interactive fiction, The Emerald Flame tells an exciting story over three distinct episodes, each packed with puzzles of varying difficulty designed to challenge and engage players of all experience levels.
Commissioned by the Koschei Historical Society, you will take on the role of a historical expert and embark on a quest to piece together a recipe for a transformative elixir by deciphering messages, interpreting alchemical diagrams, and manipulating mysterious artifacts. 
Play cooperatively as a group or go on a solo adventure! Each of the 3 chapters takes about 2-3 hours to solve, totaling 6-9 hours of gameplay. 
PostCurious, the company behind the “insidiously clever” puzzle adventure The Tale of Ord, invites you to be part of the story and uncover what many have sought for centuries: what hides in the glow of The Emerald Flame.   
The Emerald Flame requires no setup, and no complicated rules. You will need an internet-connected device for the use of a web browser, but there is no outside knowledge or research required.   
Explore the objects, solve puzzles, and submit your solutions into an online chat to get responses in real time. If you get stuck on a puzzle, don’t worry! You’ll have a detailed online hinting system at your disposal should you need a nudge in the right direction.
 CLICK HERE TO VIEW THE RULES DOC 
The base game will include a refill kit that will allow for one additional play-through by another group. UPDATE: Because we have hit a stretch goal, Kickstarter backers at the Junior Alchemist and up level will receive a 2nd refill kit. More on the refill kit below.   
It would mean so much to us if you would help us reach our funding goal by pledging for a copy of the game! We do also understand that everyone’s circumstances are different in these uncertain times. As long as supplies last, Patron and Apprentice backers will be able to upgrade their pledge at a later date when things are hopefully more certain.    
UPDATE: The enamel pin poll is open in update #8. Because we reached our $150k stretch goal, the winner of the poll will be included for Junior Alchemist backers, and BOTH pins will be included in the Apprentice Pack! 
Join us for puzzles throughout the campaign! 
The story of The Emerald Flame revolves around working with the Koschei Historical Society to analyze a legendary alchemist’s work… but The Koschei Society first needs your help to find that work! You are being invited to join the investigation at its earliest stages and help them follow a series of clues that will hopefully lead to the location of the alchemist’s hiding spot.   
We expect to find 5 artifacts, one of which will be posted on the Koschei Society forum every Wednesday evening, before being shared publicly on Thursdays in our campaign updates and on social media. You can join the forum to see the puzzles early and/or to solve them with others as a group!
To join the forum, find the two words hidden somewhere on this Kickstarter page. One will complete this link www.koscheisociety.org/__________ (10 letters) and the other will give you a 5-letter password (enter in lowercase) to access the page. Regardless of whether or not you join the forum, any backer who submits all 5 correct answers before the end of the campaign will be entered to win a special art prize! You can submit your answers at www.koscheisociety.org/submit.
If you're having trouble figuring out the password, take a look at the banner below and see if a tilt in perspective helps. :)   
Now that we have hit our funding goal, we’ve got lots of great stretch goals for The Emerald Flame, including upgraded components and additional items! You can help us reach them by sharing the project on social media - the more people we can get it out to, the more we can unlock all sorts of goodies! 
 Share the project and follow at the links below! 
PostCurious Website
Facebook
Instagram
Twitter
Board Game Geek
Always another puzzle! With The Emerald Flame in your hands you can discover 3 secret messages hiding in the box artwork.
About the refill kit: Now that we have hit our first stretch goal, the refill kit will include one set of replacements for the non-reusable components, should you want to repackage and pass the game on to someone else. PDFs will be also be provided for the paper components in case extras are needed or if you are playing with a friend remotely. One of our next stretch goals is an additional copy of the refill kit, which would mean a total of 3 possible play-throughs of the game.    
Rest assured we did our best to find the most reliable and affordable shipping options we could, and are also subsidizing shipping to all regions by $3 USD. Please note that the chart below shows shipping estimates, and shipping will be charged after the campaign using a pledge manager. Depending on your location and postage prices at the time of fulfillment, it may be necessary to adjust the shipping cost by a small amount.   
**Rest of the world disclaimer: We are willing to ship worldwide, but please note that countries not listed in the shipping chart above will be considered “ship at your own risk” areas, meaning we cannot be held responsible for mishandled packages. COVID-19 guidelines have also forced the USPS to temporarily suspend shipping to certain countries around the world. We do not know when these restrictions will be lifted, and it’s very possible this won’t be relevant by the time rewards are shipped out, but for the time being we will not be able to ship to the countries on this list.
To streamline the process as much as possible and offer more affordable shipping to international backers, we plan to warehouse in the US and UK, partnering with Quartermaster Logistics for backers in the Americas, Oceania, and Asia, and GamesQuest for backers in the UK and Europe. Please note that while we are offering customs friendly shipping to USA, Canada, UK, EU, Australia, New Zealand, & China backers, we cannot be responsible for VAT or customs charges incurred outside of these regions. 
Play The Emerald Flame in your language: The majority of puzzles in The Emerald Flame do not depend on language and the few that do require only a very basic understanding of English. To make The Emerald Flame more accessible to a global audience, we currently plan to translate all the text in the game to make playing in Spanish, German, and French as easy as possible. Players will be able to download a free PDF and read all the clues and letters in their chosen language while using the physical components to solve the puzzles. For other language requests feel free to reach out to us and if there is significant demand we will look into the possibility.
Juega a The Emerald Flame (La llama esmeralda) en tu propio idioma: La resolución de la mayoría de los acertijos de Emerald Flame no depende del idioma, y los pocos en los que es necesario basta con unas nociones básicas de inglés. De cara a hacer Emerald Flame más accesible a nivel global, estamos traduciendo todos los textos incluidos en el juego al español, para así facilitar el juego en la medida de lo posible. Los jugadores podrán descargarse gratuitamente un archivo PDF, y así leer todas las pistas y cartas en el idioma que prefieran, al tiempo que utilizan todos los componentes físicos para resolver el puzle.
Spielen Sie die Emerald Flame (Die smaragdgrüne Flamme) in Ihrer Sprache: Die meisten Rätsel in die Emerald Flame hängen nicht von der Sprache ab und die wenigen, die nur ein sehr grundlegendes Verständnis der englischen Sprache erfordern. Um die Emerald Flame einem globalen Publikum zugänglicher zu machen, übersetzen wir den gesamten Text des Spiels, um das Spielen auf Deutsch so einfach wie möglich zu gestalten. Die Spieler können ein kostenloses PDF herunterladen und alle Hinweise und Buchstaben in der von ihnen gewählten Sprache lesen, während sie die physischen Komponenten verwenden, um die Rätsel zu lösen.
Jouez àThe Emerald Flame (La Flamme d’Émeraude) dans votre langue : La plupart des énigmes présentes dans The Emerald Flame ne sont associées à aucune langue et les quelques énigmes qui le sont ne requièrent que des connaissances de base de l’anglais. Ceci dit, afin de rendre The Emerald Flame accessible au plus grand nombre et afin de vous offrir une expérience de jeu plus personnelle, nous avons décidé de traduire tous les textes en français. Vous pourrez donc télécharger un fichier PDF gratuit contenant toutes les lettres et tous les indices du jeu traduits dans votre langue, tout en utilisant le matériel original pour résoudre les secrets et les mystères qui vous attendent.
After two years of development, we could not be more excited to get the game into everyone’s hands as soon as possible. If everything goes according to plan we should be able to deliver MUCH SOONER than what is shown on this schedule, but due to the complexity of manufacturing this game and the current global circumstances, we are being overly cautious with our promised ship dates in case we encounter any unexpected delays.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Design & Artwork

The main design and artwork in the game is fully finished, with the exception of some last details and final formatting. These will be done immediately after the Kickstarter campaign ends while we wait for the funds so there should be no delays on the creative front. If we reach certain stretch goals, there may be some additional artwork to produce, but we don’t foresee this causing any delay as it can be completed during the sampling phase.

Manufacturing 

This will be PostCurious’ first time working with a manufacturer, which comes with its own challenges. The Emerald Flame is a complex game to produce, so sampling with the factory may take some time. The production copy will be fully inspected by us to make sure everything looks and works the way it should. Please note that due to material availability and manufacturing processes, some components may appear different than shown in the prototype images. As with any project that has complex custom components, there is also a risk of changes or delays, which is why we’ve factored in extra time for manufacturing. We want to make sure the game is perfect for all our backers, and will always keep you updated in case of any changes.

Shipping & Fulfillment

Delivering hundreds of games around the world is not an easy task, and there are many potential factors that could cause delays. We’ll be partnering with Quartermaster Logistics for backers in the Americas, Australia, and Asia, and GamesQuest for backers in the UK and Europe. Both companies are experts in the field and we have full confidence in their ability to troubleshoot whatever obstacles may arise. Please note that while we guarantee customs friendly shipping to USA, Canada, UK, EU, AU, NZ & China backers, we cannot be responsible for VAT or customs charges incurred outside of these regions. Please also note that shipping will be charged after the campaign, and the numbers shown in the shipping chart are estimates only.

Countries not listed in the chart of the “shipping” section above on this page are considered to be “ship at your own risk” areas, meaning we cannot be responsible for mishandled packages in those regions. It is unclear how Brexit will affect shipping into the EU, but we’ve been assured by GamesQuest that there are contingency plans in place should the outcome create obstacles in fulfillment. We do not expect this to affect anyone’s rewards, but we will keep you posted if any changes occur. 

Unforeseen Events

Throughout this process there is always a large number of variables at play, and many factors that could cause delays or changes. This could include severe weather, a global pandemic, or other unexpected circumstances. It is impossible to predict the outcome of such events or how they might affect the production of this project, but we will do everything we reasonably can to make sure the rewards are produced and delivered as promised. We are 100% committed to our backers and will always be sure to notify you with any changes that might affect this project’s content, timeline, shipping, or otherwise. 

Refunds 

Refund requests received within 14 days of the end of the Kickstarter will be honored in full. Refunds requested after two weeks have passed will be subject to a 15-20% cancellation fee due to Kickstarter fees and administrative expenses. Once your order has been processed for shipping, we will no longer be able to offer refunds. Please note that anyone who does not complete the pledge manager by our required deadlines will not be eligible for a refund, and may encounter delays in receiving their rewards. 

By pledging to this project you are indicating that you understand and give consent to the risks, challenges, and pledge terms laid out above.

updates.update_content:
Production Status
We're unfortunately continuing to experience delays in production. The lasting effects of the past year and a half continue to impact our project and industry, and we have not avoided the global repercussions of the crisis.
However, we are making progress: our manufacturer has informed us that a mass production copy of The Emerald Flame will be dispatched to us next week for final approval. Our fulfillment partners are on standby to book the freight shipments as soon as we have a final completion date from the manufacturer, and we already have our company registered in the UK and EU in order to comply with the new VAT requirements and avoid delays in customs. We believe we've set ourselves up for a smooth fulfillment process, but until production wraps up all we can do is wait and provide you with updates as we get more information.

Hello dear backers! We're coming up on the anniversary of the campaign launch and we wanted to extend our gratitude for a year of support and encouragement from all of you. We have not been resting on our laurels; the incredible success of the campaign has enabled us to work with the best manufacturing and production teams in the business. 
We knew when we began structuring our campaign in spring 2020 that certain realities overshadowed our intentions, thus we built in realistic runway times and expectations into our production plan. Though we wish we could be celebrating the imminent fulfillment of your pledge, those realities now substantially impact our timeline.
We've recently been informed by our manufacturer that the production team has been overbooked and has been facing challenges with sourcing certain materials. As a consequence, of the projects they currently have in production are being delayed by several weeks, so we're in the same boat as many other creators who are experiencing this delay. As you might imagine, we were devastated to receive this news. We did everything we could to get this project prioritized since it was scheduled to be completed sooner, but unfortunately the situation at this point is out of our hands. We've worked hard to provide transparency throughout the process and understand that this development is disappointing, but we appreciate your continued patience as we navigate these challenges. If production is completed on the current estimated timeline and the freight pickup goes smoothly, fulfillment should begin in late August, which would conform to our original production outline.

updates.update_content:
Production Update
The manufacturing of The Emerald Flame has begun! It is a relief to finally reach this stage and anticipate its fulfillment in the near future. In the past few weeks we received new samples of all the updated components and saw some great improvements:
The thickness of all the envelopes has been increased for more durability.

I'll be keeping this update short and sweet--there isn't a ton to report, but the big news is that production will begin at the end of the month!
In the last few weeks we conducted a playtest with the pre-production prints and as a result were able to approve the majority of components for manufacturing. At this moment we are waiting on newly revised samples for some envelopes, the journal, and one more component, but since 90% of the components are ready to go, our manufacturer has agreed to start printing the approved pieces while we finalize the rest.

campaign.story:
Expand the stories behind your favorite board games!
For years, CMON and Guillotine Games have collaborated on multiple projects, bringing unforgettable settings and characters to the tabletop. The worlds created inspired the imagination of thousands of players all over the world, providing them with exciting adventures, full of danger and battles against all forms of evil.
Now, we joined forces with great authors and illustrators from the comics world to take it to the next level and explore these settings like never before! Get ready to experience Zombicide, Cthulhu: Death May Die, and Zombicide: Invader in a whole new way, with beautifully illustrated, brilliantly written, hardcover graphic novels. And on top of it, get exclusive extra content not only for the comics but for the board games that inspired them! 
Author of Italian comic book series and novels, Stefano is 54 years old and lives and works on the shores of Lake Iseo, near Bergamo. He began his comic book career in 1990, writing stories for many characters including TMNT (Mirage Studios), SPIDER-MAN (Marvel), LIFE ZERO (Panini Comics), ANGIE DIGITWIN (TIM). For Sergio Bonelli Editore, together with Luca Enoch, he created the fantasy character of DRAGONERO.
Author of comic book series and novels, he lives and works in Milan as both a writer and cartoonist. His career began as a graphic designer and illustrator, for publishing and advertising houses. In 1992 he created his first character "Sprayliz", for the comics magazine “L’Intrepido”. For Sergio Bonelli Editore created the series “Gea”, in 1999, and “Lilith” In 2008. For the French market he wrote the sci-fi fantasy series “Morgana” and historical detective story “Rangaku”. In 2007, Enoch published "Dragonero", written together with Stefano Vietti, a graphic novel which, since 2011, became a monthly series, and is still published worldwide. 
Alessio Moroni is a cartoonist from Turin, Italy. He made his debut in 2016 as artist and co-creator of the creator-owned series "Darwin", written by Giulio Gualtieri. He works as penciller and inker for the series "Caput Mundi" for Editoriale Cosmo, "WeRace" for Scuderia Ferrari, and "Orfani" for Sergio Bonelli publisher. He carries on collaborating with Bonelli on "Dragonero".
A comic book artist from Salerno, Marco started his career drawing a documentary series on prehistoric monsters for Zenescope. He continued to collaborate in the US market with IDW (TMNT) and Aftershock Comics (Volition). Co-creator of the anthropomorphic western Djungle, by Panini Comics, he also worked on a Chiuaua Werewolves for Sony Hero Records. 
Riccardo is an Italian comic book author, illustrator, game designer and conceptual artist. He worked with Kappa edizioni, Mondadori, Le Lombard, Editions Soleil and Les Humanoïdes Associés. He created the character of Rigor Mortis the Evil Genius, for which he wrote comic stories and published novels between 1994 and 2005. He also worked on the board game Kragortha, and the card games Looterz (CMON) and Aye, Dark Overlord (Pendragon/Giochi Uniti). He currently works for Sergio Bonelli Editore on the Dragonero and Dragonero Adventures series, and on the new ongoing series Sottosopra.
Simone is a comics drawer, inker and colorist born in 1979 at Udine, Italy. He has worked with several publishers in Italy including: CMON, Sergio Bonelli Editore, Disney, BD edizioni, Red Whale, Kinder & Ferrero, Piemme, Salani editore, Gotem Studio, Rainbow, Soleil, and Renoir Comics.
Giancarlo has worked as a comic artist since 1991. With a group of colleagues, he created the series Fullmoon Project (1991 Eden) and Hammer (1994 Star comics). In those years he also worked for Lazarus Ledd (Star Comics). In 1996 he started collaborating with Sergio Bonelli Editore, drawing several characters (Nathan Never, Legs Weaver, Dragonero, Orfani...). He has also collaborated with Editions Soleil (2012 L'or des Fous) S.Paolo Editions/Marvel (2006/07 Next 02 – Spider-Man) and Disney (2004 Kyllion).
Filipe Pagliuso is an artist based in Brazil. He graduated in Graphic Design and started to study drawing and painting on his own after that. He worked for companies like Games Workshop and CD Projekt Red, and is currently part of CMON’s Art team. He collaborated in many different projects, bringing to life several cool characters like some of the Abominations from Zombicide: 2nd Edition, and the insanities in Cthulhu: Death May Die. 
After completing a BA Honors in Fine Art, Stefan worked in various design fields, including 5 years in Games Workshop’s Production and Design Studios in Nottingham as a Photoshop consultant, project coordinator and digital illustrator. From 2004 he started working as a freelance illustrator. He started working primarily for the games industry, helping visualize and realize the weird and wonderful ideas from the minds of some great companies around the world. Stefan now lives with his family in West Yorkshire, working full time as part of the CMON team, creating artwork for titles like Death May Die and A Song of Ice and Fire.
Pedro Núñez is a painter and illustrator based in Madrid, Spain, and has more than 15 years' experience in the entertainment industry as a concept artist, designer and art director. After working for animation studios and TV commercial projects, he worked as a concept artist in the entire KONAMI - Castlevania Lords of Shadow saga including the tittle for NINTENDO "Castlevania  Mirror of Fate". Pedro then moved to Nottingham to join the GAMES WORKSHOP art department as an illustrator, with which he has collaborated for the past 10 years. As a freelance artist, in addition to working for GW, he has regularly collaborated with Bigchild Creatives, developing art on projects such as "Rum & Bones", concept, cover, and character art for the "A Song of Ice and fire" miniatures game. Currently, Pedro has joined the staff of Bigchild creatives, being hired as art director where he will continue adding his talent to such well-known licenses as Zombicide.
Born in 1978 in the north east of Italy, Paolo is an illustrator, cartoonist, colorist and mosaicist. He works for various national and foreign publishing houses, like Marvel, Dark Horse, Glènat, Soleil, and Sergio Bonelli Editore. For the latest he also works as a consultant, managing the colors section of the series Dragonero. He uses digital media for everyday work, but continues to love the use of watercolors or acrylics for his more personal work.
Marina is the lettering manager at Sergio Bonelli Editore. After studying drawing for fabrics in Como, Italy, and following a screenwriting course in Milan, she began her career in 1984 as a freelancer in Rizzoli Editore and in Sergio Bonelli Editore. She has worked in SBE since 1985, dealing with manual and digital lettering, font creation and editing font, and supervision and control of technical file parameters. Other collaborations: Glenat, Dargaud and freelance authors. Great passion: the creation of manual calligraphy.
Born in 1991 in Alzano Lombardo, Italy, Matteo is a lover of basketball, fantasy books, comics, cinematography and art in general; the music nourishes his creations. After completing high school, Matteo started his career as a graphic designer in advertising. Life brought him to enroll at the Politecnico University of Milan. During the studies, he continued to work in an independent graphic design studio, with a focus on 3D graphic modeling and advertising. Among others, he collaborates with another graphic studio specialized in sportswear design focused on basketball. In 2017 he graduated with a Bachelor’s degree of Communication Design. In the same year he started the collaboration with Sergio Bonelli Editore, within the Dragonero comic series team – the beginning of his career as graphic designer in the publishing field.

Risks and challenges
This is our 44th Kickstarter, and there are some vagaries in terms of timing when it comes to anything produced in China, such as:
Production delays
Shipping delays
Customs delays 

The estimated delivery date for this project is February 2021, but keep in mind this is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

We've done our best to minimize this as much as possible, and we are always happy to refund pledges if for some totally unforeseen reason the game can't be delivered at all.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment, no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds after the 14 days close of the campaign may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card. This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the 8 week window has elapsed. Unconfirmed pledges make it difficult for us to plan production and logistics, and in the past have led to project delays. For this project we do not intend to allow this to happen, which may mean if you confirm your pledge too late, exclusive items may not be produced in sufficient quantity for your pledge.

If you confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret we are unable to ship to PO Boxes.

All backers that have selected “No Reward” on Kickstarter, that wish to receive a reward for this campaign, must make sure to confirm their order by the Pledge Manager Deadline. We will announce the date for this once the Pledge Manager becomes live. All “No Reward” pledges will be treated as donations once the Pledge Manager Deadline has passed.

If you do not accept these terms please do not pledge on this project, but instead wait for the retail release.

To make sure you have the best gaming experience, all CMON products are warrantied against manufacturing defects for 2 years from the of date purchase from CMON (proof of purchase required). If you open your game and see that something is missing or broken, our customer service team will work hard to get you replacement parts and make things right. Simply contact them at https://support.cmon.com/hc/en-us. Note: Warranty does not cover accidental damage, theft, loss, or any other event that is not a manufacturing defect.

updates.update_userinfo: Advance Production Sample | Death May Die Comic Extras
updates.update_content:
We hope you are all safe and well.
The CNY break is winding down to an end and factories are slowly starting to re-open, meaning that production will start to move forward again. It takes a few days for everything to return to the usual pace, but we can already see some signs of things getting back to normal: We have just received the very first production sample of the printed components! These samples are basically the last stage of production approvals. They should look and feel exactly like the final copies that will arrive to you. Once they're approved, the factory moves forward to finalize production and assembly of the products, which should also be approved by us while checking these samples and assembly guides sent out by the factory, then packing the pledges, and finally shipping. So let's check out how Death May Die rewards are looking!

We hope everyone is safe and well. Our factories have officially started their Chinese New Year holidays, which means that production will stop briefly for this time period. Gladly however, shortly before, we received some pictures from the mass production of the miniatures.
